headlines: Sudha Murty in Rajya Sabha: Who are the other nominated members and what is the process?
content: The philanthropist and former Infosys Foundation chairperson is the 12th nominated member of the Upper House and has the next six months to join a political party.

headlines: Major takeaways from Congress first list for LS polls: Message to veterans, emphasis on south
content: Congress insiders say Rahul Gandhi, who has been named again from Wayanad, may also contest from Amethi in UP, suspense continues over Priyanka Gandhi’s poll debut from Raebareli

headlines: BJP-TDP on the cusp of a poll deal, announcement likely after another round of talks tonight
content: Chandrababu Naidu, Pawan Kalyan to meet Amit Shah and J P Nadda to  discuss details of seat-sharing agreement

headlines: Battleground Azamgarh: To retain Akhilesh’s former seat, BJP banks on Modi blitz
content: As SP looks to wrest control of its former stronghold, which it lost in a bypoll two years ago, BJP goes all out to win Azamgarh, which is crucial to its bid to sweep Purvanchal.

headlines: As PM Modi announces another LPG price cut, why gas subsidies and elections go hand in hand
content: The reduction of Rs 100 per cylinder comes just months after the Centre slashed prices ahead of Assembly polls in five states, including three key Hindi heartland states.

headlines: BJP’s choice to take on Asaduddin Owaisi in Hyderabad: Long-time RSS worker, mother of three
content: Madhavi Latha, who grew up in Old City area of Hyderabad, says she understands the diversity of cultures, will not let it become a Hindu-Muslim election

headlines: As RSS apex body meets, Manipur, Sandeshkhali, farmer protests top of mind; to skirt Kashi, Mathura rows
content: On UCC, Sangh to reiterate that tribal communities be kept out, suggest "wider consultation" so that every region can "come up with a solution and best possible application"

headlines: Decode Politics: Why TDP is in Delhi for another shot at alliance with BJP
content: TDP saw its seats and vote share slide between when it fought polls in partnership with BJP, and alone

headlines: Today in Politics: Is BJP set to seal alliance with TDP, JSP? Buzz grows as Naidu, Pawan Kalyan meet Amit Shah, Nadda
content: PM Modi is likely to make some announcements on International Women’s Day; PM will present first-ever National Creators Award.

headlines: 24 years after Biju Patnaik confidant was expelled from BJD, Naveen welcomes his son back
content: Arabinda, a greenhorn in politics, has been actively involved in public-connect exercise in his father’s bastion, Patkura Assembly segment in coastal Kendrapada district, after quitting his corporate job abroad.

headlines: Congress CEC clears Rahul Gandhi from Wayanad, Bhupesh Baghel Rajnandgaon
content: CEC met to clear names of 60 candidates from 10 states, including Kerala, Karnataka, Telangana, Delhi and Chhattisgarh.

headlines: ‘Our apprenticeship promise is like MNREGA. We will make it a legal right … a world first’: Congress manifesto panel memberSubscriber Only
content: Praveen Chakravarti elaborates on promise to fill “30 lakh govt posts”, says a Congress government will ensure that anybody seeking apprenticeship gets it for annual stipend of Rs 1 lakh

headlines: As Rahul Yatra enters Gujarat today, a battered Congress awaits him
content: A series of exits have marked the run-up to the march, with the party admitting it is difficult to hold on to people after long, "power-less" years in the wilderness

headlines: Another shock for Congress, this time in Kerala: Former CM Karunakaran’s daughter Padmaja joins BJP
content: Till 3 days ago, Padmaja was part of party rallies; brother and Vadakara MP K Muraleedharan says: “The soul of my father will not condone her... I am snapping all ties with her"

headlines: As Congress’s former Varanasi MP joins BJP, why losing him may hurt the party
content: Rajesh Mishra is said to have been upset with the Congress since last year because it chose Ajay Rai, another east UP leader, to head the state unit.

headlines: Alarm bells in INDIA as AIMIM plans to expand Lok Sabha poll footprint: UP to Bihar, Mumbai to Marathwada
content: Asaduddin Owaisi’s party is looking to contest 20 seats in UP and 7 in Bihar, with Oppn bloc worrying this may dent its crucial minority base in the heartland

headlines: Assam TMC says seat-sharing chances with INDIA partners ‘slim’
content: Party says if there is no seat sharing in Bengal, there will be no such arrangement in Assam too

headlines: Decode Politics: Why BJD, BJP alliance makes sense? Nearly 50% vote shareSubscriber Only
content: Lok Sabha or Assembly, when the two parties were aligned for 11 years, they got nearly half the votes and dominated the state. Split cost BJP, but it has been gaining ground, as Cong disintegrates

headlines: Today in Politics: All eyes on PM Modi’s Kashmir rally, first since Article 370 abrogation; BJP-BJD tie-up set to be sealed
content: Congress Central Election Committee is holding its first meeting Thursday to start finalising party candidates for LS polls; Rahul Yatra heads to Gujarat

headlines: 15 years after snapping ties, BJD set to return to NDA fold
content: The speculation of the reunion of the two erstwhile allies gathered momentum after the Patnaik-led party supported Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in the recent Rajya Sabha elections as the BJP lacked the numbers to push his candidature.

headlines: Days after Tripura accord, Oppn Tipra set to join BJP Cabinet, bags two berths
content: LoP Animesh Debbarma and Tipra MLA Brishaketu Debbarma to be inducted into Manik Saha ministry; swearing-in likely on Thursday

headlines: Tapas Roy joins BJP after quitting TMC, says he wants to build peaceful Bengal by ousting ‘anarchist govt’
content: He is being seen as a potential BJP candidate from Kolkata Uttar Lok Sabha constituency.

headlines: As Sandeshkhali puts women at heart of Bengal battle, a look at their numbers
content: More men than women among the state’s registered voters, but 17 of 42 LS seats saw a greater turnout percentage for women than men in 2019; in Basirhat, under which Sandeshkhali falls, the turnout for men was far more

headlines: The collapse of a party: Days to go for Lok Sabha polls, where are Mayawati, BSP?Subscriber Only
content: 2022 Assembly polls saw BSP's worst performance. With no checking of slide since, Mayawati aloof, mixed messaging on BJP and series of exits, party leaders are directionless

headlines: 30-32 seats for party, 16-18 for allies: BJP hopes for this deal in Maharashtra
content: While BJP leaders claim allies cautioned to shed “unreasonable aggression”, Ajit Pawar NCP and Shinde Sena leaders deny that formula finalised, say talks still on

headlines: As PM Modi comes bearing schemes for Kashmir, question uppermost is when will J-K see state polls
content: First visit by Modi after abrogation of Article 370, he last visited Kashmir in February 2019; there has been no engagement with Kashmir leaders since June 2021

headlines: Akhilesh goes all out to boost SP first family’s Lok Sabha chances: Induction drive to pacifying rebels
content: Of the Akhilesh clan’s strongholds such as Mainpuri, Firozabad, Kannauj, Badaun and Azamgarh, the party currently has only one seat, Mainpuri, won by Dimple in 2022 bypoll

headlines: Meet sole Muslim face in BJP LS list so far: Controversial ex-VC of Calicut Univ
content: “In Malappuram, there is a significant change in the approach of Muslims, especially among educated ones, towards the BJP,” says party's candidate from seat, M Abdul Salam

headlines: New names less than half; more changes in seats BJP won in 2019 rather than lost: First list for LS polls
content: The 195 names include 108 sitting MPs, while 33 sitting MPs dropped, many of them are MLAs now; very few turncoats in list

headlines: Arvind Kejriwal as ‘Shravan Kumar’, ‘Ram Rajya’: Why AAP deployed religious imagery in Delhi Budget
content: Ram, Ram Rajya, and Ramayana. Delhi Finance Minister Atishi mentioned the three at least 40 times in 90 minutes while presenting the Budget on Monday.

headlines: Under Karnataka pact, BJP, JD(S) faces may switch symbols in some LS seats
content: An 'exchange formula' is under BJP-JD(S) consideration, especially for Old Mysore region where BJP is looking to repeat its 2019 sweep

headlines: Meet new faces in Yogi Cabinet: Purvanchal proponent, non-Yadav OBC leader, Jayant Chaudhary aide, lawyer
content: Besides accommodating BJP's allies SBSP and RLD ahead of LS polls, CM Adityanath seeks to balance caste and regional equations in expanding his ministry

headlines: Body blow for INDIA bloc in J&K: National Conference says will contest all 3 Valley seats, PDP still holds out hope
content: NC decision places a question mark over the future of the Gupkar alliance as PDP and the party led by the Abdullahs will be pitted against each other in LS polls

headlines: Congress likely to announce LS poll promises for youth today: What is on the cards
content: Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi expected to announce these promises at a public meeting in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district.

headlines: Today in Politics: PM Modi back in Bengal, Congress likely to unveil poll promises for the youth
content: Plus, the BJP leadership is expected to meet in Delhi to discuss Lok Sabha candidates from Karnataka.

headlines: ‘India a subcontinent, not country’, remarks on Ram: What DMK’s A Raja said, triggering political firestorm
content: As BJP hits out at Raja, DMK's ally Congress urges restraint, RJD distances itself from the comments

headlines: First Lalu, now A Raja: INDIA bloc keeps lobbing full tosses at Modi, BJP
content: The comments of the RJD chief and the DMK leader have provided the PM with the opportunity to centre the discourse around him.

headlines: Thiruvananthapuram battle of the biggies: BJP feels it has answer for Shashi TharoorSubscriber Only
content: BJP candidate Rajeev Chandrasekhar, whose slogan is 'Ini Karyam Nadakkum' (Now things will work), believes every voter in the constituency wants to be part of Modi's 'developed India project'

headlines: Justice Abhijit Gangopadhyay not the first: When two SC judges quit judiciary to run for office
content: While former CJI K Subba Rao stepped down three months before retirement to contest the 1967 presidential elections, Justice Baharul Islam was a Congress MP before he joined the judiciary and resigned in 1983 to return to Parliament

headlines: From the Urdu Press: ‘What became of Modi guarantees on jobs, black money… Can Bihar show INDIA the way?’
content: ‘Modi had made several big promises to the country for 2014 polls too. No one is ready to even question what happened to them. On top of that list was Modi’s pledge to provide 2 crore jobs to the people annually,’ writes Siasat

headlines: 6 sitting MPs dropped, more likely: A look at BJP reshuffle in Madhya Pradesh
content: Pragya Thakur, who drew PM's rap for her Godse remarks, and remained unavailable in her seat, among those out; tickets to Shivraj Chouhan and Jyotiraditya Scindia influenced other changes

headlines: A lot riding on women’s votes, TMC and BJP go all out in Bengal as Sandeshkhali episode plays out
content: While women are a crucial constituency for the BJP and part of its poll push nationally, they are also central to the TMC’s plans to thwart Modi who is all set to return to Bengal on Wednesday.

headlines: Sticking to script? When films meet pollsSubscriber Only
content: Like 2019, Bollywood has lined up a series of films in sync with govt message; in Andhra, it’s a battle of plots

headlines: ‘We joined Samajwadi Party for being a party of the ideology of Ram Manohar Lohia, not Periyar’: Ex-SP chief whipSubscriber Only
content: Manoj Pandey, among the SP MLAs believed to have voted for BJP in RS polls, attacks party's failure to take action against Swami Prasad Maurya, says always admired PM, CM for many measures.

headlines: Under ED scanner over ‘govt fund laundering’, Cong ex-MLA: Who is Salman Khurshid’s wife Louise
content: A TV channel 'sting' in 2012 purportedly uncovered that Louise Khurshid-run Zakir Hussain Memorial Trust had allegedly misappropriated govt grants meant for disabled people

headlines: Today in Politics: PM Modi in Odisha amid speculation of BJP-BJD reunion, Yogi to expand UP Cabinet
content: Plus, Amit Shah heads to Maharashtra to resolve seat-sharing disputes in the ruling alliance, and Justice Abhijit Gangopadhyay will unveil his plans after quitting the judiciary.

headlines: Gujarat Congress exodus continues, another big name quits: Who is Arjun Modhwadia?
content: Former LoP Arjun Modhwadia slams Congress stand on Ram temple event, leaders admit he was ignored; speculation is rife that he is all set to join BJP.

headlines: Blow to TMC as senior, much-liked leader Tapas Roy quits party, felt ‘abandoned’ after ED raid
content: Yet to announce future plans, Tapas Roy, who was seen as belonging to Abhishek Banerjee camp, expected to join BJP.

headlines: Keeping councillors under tight leash, BJP claws back in Chandigarh civic body
content: Wins both the Senior Deputy Mayor and Deputy Mayor posts with a margin of 3, after rap by apex court over ‘botched’ mayoral polls

headlines: Congress MP Naseer Hussain at heart of ‘pro-Pak’ slogan row from a family of freedom fighters
content: Student leader from JNU, the newly elected Rajya Sabha MP rose up the Congress ranks, was part of Standing Committees in Parliament.

headlines: Women’s Day to see next big BJP push: Modi govt lines up announcementsSubscriber Only
content: Prime Minister to address BJP Mahila Morcha meeting in Bengal on March 7; party believes that in previous Assembly polls, it could not stall Mamata’s third term because of the “overwhelming support” she enjoys among women

headlines: Delimitation puts Assam’s 3 Congress MPs in fix over LS seats
content: With the contours of their seats changed, Gaurav Gogoi and Pradyut Bordoloi both want to contest from Nagaon, while Barpeta MP demands change of seat to Dhubri

headlines: Decode Politics: How SC in 1998 came to grant legislators immunity in bribery cases
content: JMM MPs Suraj Mandal, Shibu Soren, Simon Marandi, and Shailendra Mahto were charged with accepting bribes to save PV Narasimha Rao’s minority government in 1993, when it was dealing with the fallout of liberalisation and Babri demolition.

headlines: Amit Shah heading to Maharashtra as NDA’s seat-sharing troubles, BJP discontent mount
content: BJP is facing internal differences as well as heat from allies over allotment of seats for LS polls in Vidarbha, North Maharashtra and Marathwada regions

headlines: As Sushma Swaraj’s daughter rises, BJP flags ‘winnability’ after Opposition raises ‘parivarvaad’ storm
content: Amid reports of divisions over Bansuri Swaraj’s nomination,  BJP closes ranks behind her;  incumbent MP Meenakshi Lekhi meets her, extends all help

headlines: The turbulent tenure of Justice Abhijit Gangopadhyay: Calcutta HC judge who took on Trinamool govt
content: In January, the judge hit the headlines after he accused a fellow High Court judge of “acting for a political party in the state” and had an altercation with the state Advocate General.

headlines: Today in Politics: PM Modi set to begin 10-day whirlwind tour of states, first stop Telangana and TN
content: Plus, Supreme Court verdict on whether legislators enjoy immunity from criminal prosecution for accepting bribes to make a speech or cast a vote in the legislature.

headlines: Breaking SP hold on Yadavs its long game, BJP now deploys Madhya Pradesh CM in UP
content: Mohan Yadav takes a dig at Akhilesh Yadav at an event in Lucknow, tells the crowd that Yadavs have the right to prosper as a community and not just “one family”.

headlines: Justice Abhijit Gangopadhyay announces resignation: In divided Bar, move raises questions on independence of judiciarySubscriber Only
content: For more than two years, both in his judicial orders and in media interviews, Justice Gangopadhyay has attacked the ruling Trinamool Congress and its leaders.

headlines: On Congress manifesto table: Germany-style apprenticeship, paper leak compensation
content: The party's manifesto committee, headed by former Union Finance Minister P Chidambaram, is in the last stages of drafting the document, according to sources.

headlines: In first list for Lok Sabha polls, why BJP overhauled Delhi, Chhattisgarh lineups
content: While the BJP swept Delhi the last two times, it won 10 of the 11 seats in Chhattisgarh in 2014 and bagged nine in 2019.

headlines: Assam Congress chief: ‘Some people will leave Congress, join BJP and it will be a temporary setback .. it is to suppress main issues’
content: "This time, main formula (for tickets) is winnability plus loyalty… (Or else) we can face what happened in MP, Goa and Manipur," says Bhupen Borah

headlines: Back to cricket, why Gautam Gambhir called time on his political career after just one termSubscriber Only
content: BJP was said to be looking to repeat the former Indian cricketer and MP as a candidate “even if not from East Delhi or a seat in the capital” and this decision “was conveyed to him”, according to a party insider.

headlines: In BJP’s Gujarat LS list, 5 sitting MPs dropped; Shah, 6 others fight from same seats
content: Six-term MP Mansukh Vasava has been repeated as a candidate from the Bharuch to take on the INDIA Alliance candidate Chaitar Vasava of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP). Mansukh Vasava won the 2019 polls by a margin of 3.34 lakh votes.

headlines: Days after defection in Telangana, 2 BRS MPs land BJP tickets as ‘exodus’ buzz grows
content: State BJP leaders say more BRS MPs may switch to their party after PM Modi’s visit to Adilabad and Sangareddy on March 4-5

headlines: Today in Politics: All eyes on Modi ministry’s last huddle ahead of LS polls, focus on vikas
content: Protesting farmers set to take a call on next course of action over ‘Dilli Chalo’ march

headlines: Two former sarpanches among 11 picked from Chhattisgarh
content: Agrawal has been fielded from Raipur, a seat being represented by party MP Sunil Soni. Agrawal currently represents Raipur South Assembly seat that he had won last year by a record margin of 67,851 votes.

headlines: Names for 51 of 80 UP seats out: Hema Malini from Mathura, Sanjeev Balyan in Muzaffarnagar
content: Two more seats are surprisingly missing from the list — Pilibhit and Sultanpur. Eight-term MP Maneka Sanjay Gandhi is sitting MP from Sultanpur and her son Varun Gandhi — a three-term MP — represents Pilibhit.

headlines: By Rahul’s side, Kamal Nath pitches his ‘message of peace and love’ during Madhya Pradesh leg of Yatra
content: Nath had been in the spotlight recently over rumours that he may join the BJP, following which the Congress went into damage-control mode to keep its flock together. Nath has dismissed the rumours as a media creation.

headlines: 2024 Lok Sabha elections | BJP’s Rajasthan picks: In three seats, how caste equations, local leaders can give party a tough fight
content: Among 15 nominees from Rajasthan in BJP's first list are Om Birla from Kota, Jyoti Mirdha from Nagaur and Mahendra Jeet Singh Malviya from Banswara

headlines: In BJP’s first list for Lok Sabha polls: Mix of old, new; social justice is the big message
content: Winnability, representation and a propensity to work quietly as per the party's requirements have all mattered — in varying degrees — in the selections. Apart from these factors, the first list does not reflect any other grand or consistent pattern.

headlines: In BJP’s Lok Sabha list for Bengal, mix of old and new faces; Suvendu’s younger brother to contest from father’s seat
content: Union ministers Nisith Pramanik, Shantanu Thakur retained; TMC slams move to field Bhojpuri actor from Asansol

headlines: ‘On my Greater Tipraland demand, nowhere in accord is written it will not be met. I have not backed down, nor have they (Centre)’: Pradyot KishoreSubscriber Only
content: The accord is 'first step towards realisation of aspirations of Tripura's indigenous people' and 'an acknowledgment of Government of India on historical injustice meted out to them' that needs 'course correction', says TIPRA founder.

headlines: Lok Sabha polls: In BJP’s first list of 195, Modi to contest again from Varanasi, Amit Shah from Gandhinagar
content: In the first list of 195 candidates, the BJP included 28 women, 47 youth, 27 Scheduled Castes, 18 Scheduled Tribes and 57 OBCs.

headlines: Amid Mamata firefighting, TMC’s ‘old vs  young’ faultline flares as Kunal targets Sudip
content: Kunal Ghosh asks who paid for TMC veteran's hospital stay in Bhubaneswar after he was arrested by CBI in 2017, threatening to even move court over it

headlines: Decode Politics | Key takeaways from ‘historic’ Tripura accord: booster for BJP, breakthrough for TIPRA Motha
content: The pact has promptly checked TIPRA chief Pradyot Kishore’s fast-unto-death stir, which could have spiralled out of control ahead of LS polls; the tribal outfit may now even consider joining NDA in due course

headlines: Odisha buzz grows ahead of PM Modi visit: Will BJD-BJP bonhomie turn into realliance?
content: On Biju Patnaik birth anniversary on March 5, Modi is likely to share stage with CM Patnaik, even as state BJP chief says the principal Oppn will strongly contest all LS and Assembly seats

headlines: Tejashwi off the blocks with Yatra, but can he run the marathon?
content: Opposition's Bihar hope, the RJD leader draws enthusiastic crowds to his Yatra, expanding party's pitch, talking jobs. But the odds remain high, with BJP formidable, his M-Y core vote watchful

headlines: After mystery dash to Delhi by Tripura top brass, TIPRA Motha chief says ‘historic accord coming today’
content: In message to supporters, Pradyot Kishore, who cut short a 'fast-unto-death' to head to Capital, says: "I said I wouldn't come back empty-handed"; CM, ministers and top Motha leaders had followed him to Delhi. An alliance with BJP may also be on cards

headlines: ‘What does Pakistan have to do with a Rajya Sabha poll in Karnataka?… I can understand BJP frustration’: Cong MP Syed Naseer Hussain
content: As BJP stalls Assembly, links cafe blast to alleged Pakistan Zindabad slogans raised after his Rajya Sabha win, Hussain says open to any investigation, "no one heard what BJP is claiming."

headlines: Decode Politics: Why dirt keeps swirling about a luxury resort in Punjab
content: Allegations have dogged the Oberoi Sukhvilas Spa Resort, partly owned by Akali Dal leader Sukhbir Singh Badal, since its construction began. Now AAP has put a figure to it: Rs 108 crore

headlines: Today in Politics: PM Modi and Nitish Kumar to share the stage in Bihar, Rahul yatra resumes
content: Plus, the wait continues for the BJP’s first list of candidates for the Lok Sabha polls. It is expected to be released over the weekend.

headlines: Neerja Chowdhury writes | RS poll debacle in Himachal to Sonia’s UP exit: Harsh light shines on a Congress in crisisSubscriber Only
content: The bottom line is clear. Without addressing its decline in Uttar Pradesh, the Congress cannot rediscover itself.

headlines: Week before Himachal fiasco, Congress knew what was coming but was clueless about its scale
content: As the Congress looks back at what went wrong during the Rajya Sabha polls in the hill state, the picture that is emerging is of miscalculation and overconfidence.

headlines: BJP may release LS polls first list over weekend; focus likely to be on star candidates, ‘weak’ seats
content: “The BJP’s advantage against the Congress is so clear that even if the latter chooses its nominees knowing who our candidates are, the popularity of PM Modi will ensure a sweep,” says a party leader

headlines: Why Sandeshkhali forced usually defiant TMC into a cornerSubscriber Only
content: The final push, though, came from the Calcutta High Court which, on Wednesday, ruled that central agencies can arrest Shahjahan. Soon after, the Bengal Police picked up the TMC strongman who had been absconding for 55 days since his followers assaulted an Enforcement Directorate team.

headlines: Yogi Cabinet expansion on the cards, will bring in RLD, SBSP
content: SBSP chief Om Rajbhar expected to join an RLD and a BJP nominee in Cabinet, expansion of Council of Ministers also likely, as Lucknow sees a spree of meetings

headlines: Decode Politics: On Karnataka caste survey report, why Siddaramaiah is facing a predicament
content: On one hand, the Karnataka CM has the opportunity to cement his legacy while on the other, he may end up dividing the party if he pushes too hard on this.

headlines: A walk-on role or more? DMK faces heat over a drug bust and a movie producer on the run
content: A K Jaffer Sadiq was a functionary in the party’s NRI wing and had photos online with top DMK leaders. Though the DMK has expelled him, the Opposition says it is not enough.

headlines: After 3 years, as PM Modi returns to Mamata turf, what we can expect
content: PM will continue with his development pitch, inaugurating and laying the foundation of projects in Hooghly and Nadia districts; but all eyes are on the political message of his speeches

headlines: Sharad Pawar’s lunch invite to CM, Dy CMs leaves both rivals, friends wondering: What’s on the menu?
content: While Pawar has said he only wanted to extend courtesy to Shinde, on his first visit to Baramati since becoming CM, others link it to heat on the veteran over Jarange Patil's continuing agitation.

headlines: In a bind over UP seats, Cong litany of woes: ‘unwinnability’, lack of key aspirants, cold SP
content: UP Cong section feels SP has not allotted the party seats it desired, pointing to six of them – Prayagraj, Amroha, Bulandshahr, Saharanpur, Deoria and Sitapur — where it has never won after 1980s

headlines: Lok Sabha polls: Deciphering PM Modi, govt push on first-time voters
content: Since 2019, the number of first-time voters has increased by almost a quarter. In every state and UT, the number of women voters has also increased by a greater proportion than their male counterparts

headlines: UP deal done but toughest stretch awaits SP, Congress: Working out Lok Sabha battle plan
content: Leaders of both parties say there are no instructions yet from the top on implementing the agreement. “There is confusion about the distribution of work.”

headlines: Today in Politics: PM Modi to visit Bengal, likely to target Mamata, TMC over Sandeshkhali
content: Plus, after late-night deliberations, will BJP release its first candidate list for Lok Sabha polls?

headlines: Himachal Congress turmoil: Away from CM’s breakfast, rebels talk of moving Supreme Court
content: While they were undecided about what they were going to have for dinner, they were very clear about the next course of action after their disqualification  by Assembly Speaker Kuldeep Singh Pathania.

headlines: The long blood line of Himachal rebellion: A feud between CM Sukhu and the late Virbhadra Singh going back years
content: The two could not have been further apart, from their backgrounds to their rise, and made that apparent. Sukhu's appointment as CM, instead of Virbhadra's wife Pratibha Singh, added fuel to the fire

headlines: CAA again on horizon, Assam Opposition prepares to raise it as poll issue, CM Sarma says go to SC
content: 16 parties hand over memorandum to President asking Modi govt to stop move to implement CAA, warn of mass agitation otherwise; DGP says any such bandh could entail recovery of crores

headlines: Ally CPM’s mouthpiece takes a swipe at Congress over Himachal, Hindutva: ‘How could it be caught napping… fight RSS like this?’
content: While attacking BJP, People's Democracy editorial talks about the Congress's divided house in Himachal, says opposition parties need "bold and consistent fight — ideologically, politically — against Hindutva communal forces"

headlines: Haryana BJP puts forward its Lok Sabha list: All sitting MPs, some big faces who lost 2019 Assembly polls
content: Recent entrants Kuldeep Bishnoi and Ashok Tanwar also figure in the list; state unit does not want tie-up with JJP for LS

headlines: 15 days, 80,000 people added across UP: BJP claims great start to target of 370 extra voters per booth
content: With PM Modi having asked every BJP worker to get 370 more votes in each booth, BJP has been holding Milan Samaroh events in heartland states, focusing on Oppn workers' induction

headlines: Now Manipur Police up in arms against Arambai Tenggol: What is the radical Meitei group?
content: Following abduction of a senior officer by the group, Manipur Police has accused it of "garnering false support" by claiming to protect the public; says that with its officers being targeted, need for roping in Central personnel may arise

headlines: Weak spot identified, Telangana Congress begins course-correcting for LS polls
content: BRS councillors, corporators are crossing over to Congress in droves as no-confidence motions help ruling party wrest control of civic bodies; alarmed BRS leaders even approached court but got no relief

headlines: A Siddaramaiah-D K Shivakumar show: How Congress managed to keep BJP, JD(S) at bay in Karnataka
content: From Cabinet-rank appointments for dozens of MLAs in January to sequestering them in a resort ahead of the election, the party took several measures that helped it avoid a Himachal Pradesh-like situation

headlines: As Left reveals its cards in Kerala, why Congress may still want Rahul Gandhi from Wayanad
content: The Congress has won the Lok Sabha seat all three times since it was created ahead of the 2009 polls, by substantial margins. However, Assembly poll fights have been closer

headlines: As farmers meet again today, how long can Haryana BJP keep away, hope anger doesn’t reach it
content: The death of a youth at a protest site, and mystery about injuries to another, have pushed the party and its government in Haryana into a corner

headlines: As BJP eyes first Lok Sabha win in Kashmir, a PDP veteran central to its plans
content: Former J&K Deputy CM Muzaffar Baig returned to the PDP in January but disassociated from the party after attending PM Modi’s Jammu rally last week.

headlines: INDIA singed by UP Rajya Sabha test, SP to rejig Lok Sabha game plan, Congress worry grows over Amethi, Raebareli
content: Eight 'rebel' SP MLAs include three Brahmin faces, two Thakur leaders, two from backward communities and one Dalit leader; they were in touch with senior BJP leaders and ministers

headlines: Aiming to reverse 2019 rout, Kerala CPI(M) bets on seasoned faces for LS polls; ropes in Shailaja, Isaac
content: Among CPI(M)'s 15 candidates in the state are four MLAs, two MPs, a minister and a Politburo member

headlines: Today in Politics: BJP’s first LS list on the cards after central panel huddle; CM Sukhu fate hangs in balance
content: Karnataka caste survey report to be submitted to CM Siddaramaiah; protesting farm unions to decide next course of 'Dilli Chalo' stir

headlines: Better to be sorry, and safe?: In fifth defamation case, Arvind Kejriwal pleads ‘mistake’
content: Arun Jaitley, Kapil Sibal, Bikram Majithia, Nitin Gadkari and now BJP IT cell, the AAP supremo has sought the same route for relief after making allegations

headlines: Decode Politics: As Himachal govt teeters, how often has draw of lots been used? Almost never
content: According to ex-CEC O P Rawat, the use of a draw of lots to decide RS polls was ‘unheard of’, though there had been rare instances of it being used in Assembly and LS elections

headlines: Newsmaker: At centre of Himachal Rajya Sabha storm is a ‘gentleman’ leader — and a Virbhadra Singh loyalist
content: Harsh Mahajan, who won Tuesday's RS election, joined BJP in 2022 after 4 decades in Congress, with his father too a party leader. Said to have been picked by Rajiv Gandhi as state Youth Congress leader, he last won an election in 2003.

headlines: In first visit to Kashmir since abrogation of Article 370, Modi to address Srinagar rally on March 7
content: The Prime Minister has been on a whirlwind tour of the country, with his speeches focusing on how his government’s schemes have touched the lives of beneficiaries.

headlines: Assam Cong’s woes since Rahul Yatra continue as another senior leader quits, BJP says ‘all MLAs’ in touch with it
content: Rana Goswami second Assam Cong working president to jump ship in two weeks, even as two party MLAs have extended support to Sarma govt

headlines: Days after Bharat Ratna, RSS wing says farmers ‘suffering’ because of experts like M S Swaminathan
content: “The farmer already has problems. By adopting ways of so-called experts, their input cost has shot up, and they are not getting remunerative prices,” says Bharatiya Kisan Sangh

headlines: Fifth YSRCP MP quits party, leaders worry if Jagan ticket shuffling a risky bet
content: A former Jagan aide, Ongole MP M Sreenivasulu Reddy reportedly wanted a ticket for his son, an accused and approver in Delhi excise scam

headlines: Cross-voting SP MLAs bring to the fore ‘upper caste’ challenge for party
content: A section of upper caste party leaders feel that the PDA motto that Akhilesh now swears by sends out an exclusionary message to them and tribals

headlines: PM Modi’s underwater dip in Dwarka also has a message for Ahirs
content: His visit included several outreach efforts towards the community, which is seen as equivalent of the Yadavs in the Hindi heartland

headlines: Decode Politics: After Rajya Sabha cross-voting, why Congress govt in Himachal hangs in the balance
content: Drama continues in state, Congress minister resigns, 15 BJP MLAs 'suspended'; as BJP threatens to seek a floor test after cross-voting by six Congress MLAs in Tuesday’s Rajya Sabha poll

headlines: Amid Nitish govt vs Governor flare-up over varsities’ control, JD(U), BJP dial down heat
content: State education dept, which has asked 39 officials to carry out inspection of colleges, is also holding a meet to discuss whether universities should take orders from Raj Bhavan or state govt

headlines: Today in Politics | After Himachal RS poll shocker, buzz grows: Can Congress govt survive Finance Bill day?
content: Cong high command sends trouble-shooters D K Shivakumar and Bhupinder Hooda to Shimla to defuse crisis; MVA allies set to meet to finalise LS seat-sharing in Maharashtra

headlines: In Kamal Nath bastion of Chhindwara, BJP on prowl, Congress tries to herd its leadersSubscriber Only
content: As Congress leaders leave, they cite both fear of BJP govt stalling funds to an indifferent leadership within own party. Meanwhile, rumours regarding Kamal Nath's plans linger

headlines: Congress loses another leader to BJP in Gujarat, former MP and son jump ship
content: The decision of five-time MP Naran Rathwa, a tribal leader, and his son Sangramsinh is a blow to the Opposition party in Chhota Udepur. where it does not have big leaders anymore

headlines: AAP fields Delhi MLAs from LS seats, no repeat of 2019 names: Ex-minister to Sisodia aide to Gujjar face
content: AAP nominates Somnath Bharti from New Delhi, Kuldeep Kumar from East Delhi, Sahi Ram Pehalwan from South Delhi and ex-Cong MP Mahabal Mishra from West Delhi

headlines: After pulling off Himachal upset in Rajya Sabha election, BJP guns for Sukhu govt: ‘Will meet Governor in the morning’
content: “We have not lost the trust. We got 34 votes and they got 34 votes. Six Congress MLAs did cross-voting … Was it a vote of resentment?” says CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu

headlines: CAA rules likely to be notified before poll code, to seek proof of India entry, religion
content: The MCC comes into force when the Election Commission announces polls. It is expected that the Lok Sabha poll dates will be announced sometime next month.

headlines: Rajya Sabha polls: Congress saves face, turns the tables in Karnataka, with help of these two BJP MLAs
content: Both S T Somashekar and Shivram  were earlier associated with Congress, joined BJP in 2019 and are seen to be miffed with the party

headlines: RS polls: ‘Betrayal’ of trusted Akhilesh aide, SP Brahmin face Manoj Pandey
content: SP chief whip resigns ahead of RS polls, speculation rife that the  three-time MLA may be fielded by BJP from Raebareli, thus also hurting Congress chances

headlines: INDIA gets a surprise in Bihar too: 3 MLAs surface in Treasury ranks, strike at Cong’s Dalit base
content: As RJD's 1 MLA and Cong's 2 say they are quitting their parties, the two protest, seek disqualification; BJP says why blame us if “Opposition rudderless”

headlines: From the Urdu Press: ‘Cong, SP, AAP tie-ups signal all is not lost in INDIA camp’, ‘In Ajit Pawar’s Muslim outreach, a message to BJP’
content: 'The Chandigarh mayoral election reflects high-handedness with which BJP has been subverting due process and crushing its opponents... In this context, the SC's verdict assumes immense significance,' writes Siasat

headlines: Rajya Sabha polls: Setback for BJP-JD(S) alliance in Karnataka; one BJP MLA cross-votes, another abstains
content: D Kupendra Reddy of JD(S) loses out on RS berth after Opposition fails to muster the 45 votes required; earlier, Yeshwanthapura MLA S T Somashekar cast a “vote of conscience” and former minister Shivaram Hebbar did not vote.

headlines: Oldest MP, a leading voice on Muslim affairs, SP’s Shafiqur Rahman Barq passes away
content: A four-time MLA and five-time MP from UP, Barq had been involved in politics since 1974 and often made headlines with his remarks in recent years

headlines: Amid reports of cross-voting in Rajya Sabha polls, how things stood before Tuesday
content: The composition of the House, where NDA is 10 short of halfway mark, was unlikely to change. Now in UP and Himachal, BJP could have an additional 2 seats by end of day

headlines: Almost all victims of mob lynching, ‘bulldozer culture’ are Pasmanda Muslims, says report
content: All India Pasmanda Muslim Mahaz draws on Bihar caste survey to underline backwardness in community, seeks laws for protection; founder-MP Ali Anwar Ansari questions Oppn “silence”

headlines: Rajya Sabha polls: A day of blows for SP, starting with chief whip; Congress too will feel the pain
content: Rajya Sabha polls: Seven SP MLAs, many with with influence in Amethi, Raebareli, believed to have cross-voted, 1 did not turn up; all 8 BJP nominees win.

headlines: BJP cold to caste census, Nitish Kumar puts demand on the back burner, rolls back events, tours
content: JD(U) may not contest LS polls outside Bihar, although K C Tyagi says party has urged BJP for one seat each in Jharkhand, UP; claims BJP not opposed to caste census

headlines: Cong 17 seats in UP deal: Why even SP help may not take party far, going by 2019
content: The vote shares of both may have helped them take just 1 seat off NDA; BJP had won 11 of the 17 seats with more than 50% votes. Story ran along same lines in 2014

headlines: Today in Politics: RS polls may end in a photo-finish in UP, Himachal, Karnataka; Rahul at Cambridge
content: PM Modi’s Kerala outreach continues, his third visit in two months; will unveil space infra projects and address rally at concluding event of state BJP’s padayatra.

headlines: Rajya Sabha polls today: Disadvantage SP in UP, Congress keeps close watch in Karnataka, Himachal
content: Rajya Sabha polls: The stage is set for a high-octane Rajya Sabha election battle in Uttar Pradesh, Karnataka, and Himachal Pradesh on Tuesday (February 27).

headlines: What does Rahul or Congress gain in contesting from Kerala… I think good sense will prevail: CPI Wayanad nomineeSubscriber Only
content: “In Kerala, it is LDF versus UDF, there is no INDIA alliance,” says Annie Raja, adds Rahul has options of TN, Karnataka, Telangana, should focus on fighting BJP

headlines: First off the blocks, Sajad Lone enters LS poll fray from Baramulla; People’s Conference to skip Jammu
content: The PC said it will take a decision on the other two constituencies in the Kashmir Valley – Srinagar and Anantnag – in due course, but will not contest any seat in the Jammu region of the Union Territory (UT).

headlines: Maratha quota: Heat on Devendra Fadnavis singeing it, Shinde govt hardens stance against activist
content: CM's warning to Jarange Patil follows central BJP taking a dim view of his attacks on Fadnavis, which were in the process helping Opposition's claims

headlines: Litany of cases against T Raja Singh: BJP’s rabble-rouser MLA known for anti-minority rhetoric
content: Singh, who is the BJP’s sole MLA in Hyderabad, has 85 active cases against him, while the police say there are 104 FIRs. Now, he is again under the scanner.

headlines: Road to 2024: BJP’s target not just 370 seats, it is also seeking to touch 50% votesSubscriber Only
content: This calculation behind the pursuit of new allies, leaders from other parties, including in states where this may not translate into seats.

headlines: After temple Bill setback, Siddaramaiah govt mulls second Assembly passage or deferral post LS polls
content: To overcome BJP-JD(S)'s challenge, Cong govt is also considering tabling the amendment Bill at a later stage when it has a majority in Legislative Council

headlines: Haryana INLD chief killing: Former BJP MLA booked is an old political rival
content: Former Bahadurgarh MLA Naresh Kaushik has been charged with murder and conspiracy in the killing of Nafe Singh Rathee, with the two having taken on each other in successive elections

headlines: Congress’s lone Jharkhand MP, Geeta Kora, now quits, joins BJP
content: The wife of former CM Madhu Kora, Geeta attended a party function as recently as Sunday, say shocked Congress leaders; BJP hopes to make gains in region which eluded it in its 2019 sweep of state

headlines: As his Twenty20 now eyes LS polls in Kerala, KITEX Group chief fires fresh salvo against CPM MLA
content: The two are at loggerheads since LDF returned to power in 2021, with KITEX shifting a project out of the state; recently CPM MLA Sreenjin filed a complaint leading to case against Sabu under SC/ST Act

headlines: Riding on Beni Prasad Verma legacy in Gonda, SP debutant Shreya braces for BJP’s Ayodhya challenge
content: Beni Prasad's granddaughter is banking on support of Muslims and Kurmis in BJP-held seat near Ayodhya, which is also considered Brij Bhushan Saran Singh's stronghold

headlines: Behind AAP, Congress’s Delhi pact for LS polls: How the two parties zeroed in on seats
content: The two parties share a common vote bank and a three-way fight would have handed over advantage to the BJP.

headlines: Today in Politics: After making some headway, will the Opposition get down to brass tacks?
content: The INDIA alliance made some progress last week as Congress stitched up seat-sharing agreements with AAP and SP. But the hard yards await.

headlines: As Akhilesh joins Rahul yatra, crowd echoes message from stage: Unemployment a concern
content: "They are talking about jobs, but so did the BJP last time. There will be enthusiasm about the alliance at the start ... will have to see what it leads to,” says a youth at Agra event

headlines: BSP MP Ritesh Pandey: ‘Had almost no link with party last two years … did not see clarity in its approach towards me’
content: “I was not invited to any party meeting after the 2022 UP Assembly elections … Like me, other MPs were also not invited. They will answer for themselves,” Pandey says after joining BJP

headlines: As ‘UP ke ladke’ Rahul and Akhilesh reunite, a look back at their 2017 partnership that failedSubscriber Only
content: The drubbing that SP and Congress received in the UP Assembly elections paved the way for the start of the Yogi Adityanath government. Both parties say they learnt the lesson from that loss.

headlines: Maratha quota row, seat-sharing divisions: For BJP, why Marathwada is a tricky terrain
content: The party won four of the eight Lok Sabha seats in the region in 2019 and is looking to make further inroads this time with Ashok Chavan’s help

headlines: Newsmaker | Another YSRCP MP quits, fires ‘Mahmud of Ghazni’ barb at Jagan Mohan Reddy in parting shot
content: Raghu Ramakrishna Raju had been at loggerheads with the party for years, was arrested in 2021 for sedition after he sought the cancellation of the Andhra CM’s bail

headlines: Decode Politics: As BSP MP Ritesh Pandey resigns, why Mayawati may be facing an exodus from her party
content: BSP chief says it is not possible to give tickets to most of the MPs, “especially when they are seen wandering here and there in their own interests and are in negative news”.

headlines: One month into Nitish Kumar’s new NDA stint, JD(U) rakes up Bihar special status demand amid BJP tightrope
content: Senior JD (U) minister Bijendra Yadav demands special economic package for Bihar in Assembly; BJP says state getting adequate Central assistance

headlines: Who is Mufti Salman Azhari: Cleric in eye of ‘hate speech’ storm, held by Gujarat police repeatedly
content: The Mumbai cleric and scholar, who has a large following on social media for his speeches, was booked under PASA and arrested third time by Gujarat police after he got bail in two cases

headlines: In blow to Tamil Nadu Congress, three-time MLA defects to BJP over denial of floor leader post, LS seat
content: Welcoming Vijayadharani to BJP, Annamalai highlighted PM Modi’s influence on her decision, saying her induction would boost the party in Tamil Nadu

headlines: Once Ahmed Patel’s seat, why Congress gave Bharuch to AAP
content: On the Congress leader’s 74th birth anniversary last year,  Chaitar Vasava and Faisal Patel shared stage, with the AAP leader extending support to Mumtaz Patel's candidature; later Vasava himself became a ticket aspirant

headlines: Today in Politics: Akhilesh set to join Rahul, Priyanka on Yatra’s final day in UP; PM Modi to unveil 5 AIIMS
content: Maratha quota activist Jarange-Patil to announce his next course of action; Siddaramaiah govt to hold Constitution awareness event in Bengaluru

headlines: Haryana Seat Sharing: AAP banks on its Punjab power as it gears up to battle BJP in Kurukshtera
content: Granted only one seats in Haryana, it is not going to be easy for AAP in Kurukshetra, a district that is being nurtured and developed by the Manohar Lal Khattar-led dispensation as a spiritual hub with the annual International Gita Mohatsav at its centre

headlines: Profanity caught on mic and a late entrance: Kerala’s top two Congress leaders play down awkward moment
content: The incident took place on Saturday in Alappuzha, where Sudhakaran and Satheesan were scheduled to jointly address the media as part of the Congress’s ongoing state-wide yatra to put key issues before the people ahead of the upcoming Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Naidu, Lokesh among 99 faces in TDP-JSP’s first list; 57 seats on hold amid BJP suspense

headlines: In boost to BJP prospects in Kashmir, NC leader latest among Paharis to join fold after legislation
content: Ex-MLC Syed Mohammad Rafiq Shah says previous govts used Paharis as a “vote bank”, but “justice” has been done to them by Modi govt, which passed Bill to grant ST status to the community

headlines: Behind Khattar govt’s U-turn on NSA against farm leaders, fear of rural blowback, Congress ‘gain’
content: As part of its damage control in Haryana ahead of polls, with Punjab farmers camped at its borders, BJP-JJP govt also announces interest and penalty waiver on farm loans

headlines: Back in Stalin’s good books, PTR has last laugh months after ‘demotion’: ‘Transformed IT sector’
content: Minister Palanivel Thiaga Rajan was shifted from Finance to IT following release of purported audio clips by Annamalai in which he allegedly castigated DMK first family

headlines: Congress and AAP seal LS pact in Delhi, Gujarat, Haryana, Goa, Chandigarh

headlines: As MLAs return to state, Jharkhand Cong says crisis has blown over. But has it?
content: The 8 MLAs who went to Delhi seeking a change in ministers return in time for Assembly session, but hold on to their woes; as BJP enjoys Cong discomfort, ally JMM watches uneasily

headlines: Decode Politics: Why SP dialled down heat to part with 17 UP seats for Cong
content: While holding that the number of LS seats allotted to a ‘weak’ Cong is ‘too high’, SP leaders say a key reason for it was the party’s fear of a split in the crucial Muslim vote

headlines: Sandeshkhali row brings up Trinamool Congress’s unique Bengal problem: Two Adhikaris too many
content: As Suvendu Adhikari continues to lead the BJP charge against Mamata govt, his father and brother retain their TMC MP status – turning the knife in during the Sandeshkhali episode

headlines: Today in Politics: Priyanka Gandhi to join Rahul for the first time in Bharat Jodo Nyay Yatra
content: Plus, PM Narendra Modi will continue unveiling and laying the foundation stone of development projects, today in Chhattisgarh.

headlines: Lok Sabha polls: As AAP candidate begins 21-day campaign in Bharuch, Congress ticket aspirant says seat-sharing decision on hold
content: Faisal told The Indian Express on Friday that the party high command has put on hold the decision on Bharuch after he wrote a letter to Gandhi. The AAP, meanwhile, has already announced its Dediapada MLA Chaitar Vasava as its candidate from Bharuch.

headlines: AAP and Congress seal Delhi pact but obstacles remain in other states, from Gujarat to Goa
content: In Gujarat, the two parties are at loggerheads over Bharuch, with AAP pushing for Dediapada MLA Chaitar Vasava while Ahmed Patel’s son Faisal has claimed he is contesting

headlines: As ED comes for SP leader over old case in UP, a throwback to the ‘Gangs of Gorakhpur’
content: On Friday, the Central agency raided several locations allegedly linked to former MLA Vinay Shankar Tiwari, whose father was famed gangster-turned-politician Hari Shankar Tiwari

headlines: Farmers’ demonstration: Punjab BJP seeks ‘restraint from govt, security forces’ as anger over death at protest site grows
content: Offering condolences over Shubhkaran's death, BJP chief Sunil Jakhar seeks "sensitivity to allow peaceful protests" from govt, tells farmers too to "guide" youngsters in right direction; BJP leaders also facilitate farmers who have laid dharnas at their homes

headlines: Decode Politics: Why a Bill on temple funds has pitted BJP against Congress
content: BJP has dubbed bid to create a common funding pool for temple revenues as “robbing” temples of funds that might be used for purposes like “building walls of kabristan”; Congress govt says the Bill will help smaller temples

headlines: As UAPA invoked against Congress MLA Mamman Khan, party closes ranks around him
content: Ferozepur Jhirka MLA who is an accused in the Nuh communal violence case says “wrong on state government’s part to implicate” him; Congress urges CM Khattar to have rethink

headlines: Waiting for BJP, Naidu-Pawan Kalyan alliance faces turbulence: seat-sharing delay to vote transfer concern
content: While both TDP supremo and JSP chief have batted for their tie-up for upcoming polls, there are 20 Assembly seats in East and West Godavari where the two allies are struggling to reach a consensus

headlines: Manohar Joshi passes away: Maharashtra’s first non-Congress CM, former LS Speaker was Bal Thackeray’s loyal aide
content: Captivated by Thackeray’s “Marathi manoos” pitch, Joshi joined the Sena in the 1960s; he was named in the Srikrishna report on the Mumbai riots of 1992-‘93 along with his mentor

headlines: Disquiet grows in Odisha BJP over bonhomie with BJD as Cong steps up bid for ‘real Oppn’
content: Many Odisha BJP leaders including ticket aspirants remain uncertain whether there will be a 'formal alliance' or just 'tactical understanding' with BJD in upcoming polls

headlines: Today in Politics: As PM Modi arrives in Varanasi, why the focus is on celebrating Sant Ravidas
content: Plus, farmers will observe “Black Day” in protest against the death of a 22-year-old on Wednesday.

headlines: When Fali Nariman raised red flags on RTI: ‘No one’s life is like an open book’
content: Kuldip Nayyar and Ram Jethmalani were among those who criticised the position Nariman took; Jethmalani said it was a rare case of his “friend” taking a conservative stand

headlines: On CBI radar now, Satya Pal Malik ran foul of Modi govt some time back, recasts himself as farmer leader
content: Political drifter with Jat and farmer roots, the former Governor of J&K under the Modi govt has been a thorn in the flesh of the Centre since he began hinting at lack of accountability in the Pulwama attack, and corruption in J&K, Goa

headlines: One battle won, a Kerala MLA to continue war for justice for husband against ruling CPI(M)
content: Since the murder of her husband by alleged CPI(M) workers in 2012, Rama has emerged as a face against political killings in North Kerala and the leader of a rebel Communist outfit

headlines: Farmers’ protest: Loan waiver among demands, how Centre has allowed it only twice
content: V P Singh government and UPA-1's were the only times the Centre announced a version of loan waiver. However, given low incomes and high indebtedness, state governments keep waiving farm loans or promising it.

headlines: Saleem Shervani interview: I don’t understand why Akhilesh so shy of using the word Muslim… I kept telling him
content: “Even after he (Akhilesh) announced PDA (Pichda, Dalits, Alpasankhyak) as our main pitch for Lok Sabha polls, when he declared the party's candidates for Rajya Sabha, we saw that ‘P’ and ‘A’ got no representation,” senior SP leader tells The Indian Express

headlines: Decode Politics: As farmer protests continue, how the ground is shifting for Punjab parties
content: AAP govt gets a breather as farmer ire is diverted away from it, Cong hopes to attract farmers by expressing open sympathy for the protest, while a determined BJP seems willing to take its chances. Does that leave Akali Dal as the worst loser?

headlines: Today in Politics: PM Modi in Ahmedabad for Amul golden jubilee; farm stir spirals over protester death
content: Amit Shah will kick off BJP’s campaign for LS polls in Chhattisgarh by addressing a rally in Janjgir Champa Thursday

headlines: Mayawati aloof, left to own devices, BSP MPs weigh options
content: 2 MPs out already, the remaining 8 wait for BSP to get in touch as LS polls approach, some reach out to other parties; 1 MP sets up own parallel organisation

headlines: The Kamal Nath puzzle: Son welcomes CM to family turf, local Cong leaders join BJP in bulkSubscriber Only
content: Nakul Nath says sought funds for his constituency; CM Mohan Yadav predicts Chhindwara will vote for BJP this time

headlines: In UP booster for INDIA, SP and Congress stitch up alliance; Priyanka call to Akhilesh ‘deal clincher’
content: Under their agreement for UP, the Congress will contest 17 seats out of 80 in the state, leaving the remaining 63 seats for the SP and its smaller allies.

headlines: Farmer protests ‘politically motivated’, MSP law demand ‘unreasonable’, says RSS-linked magazine
content: The Organiser editorial claims farm stir, Haldwani protest and opposition to Sandeshkhali probe are part of 'larger game to disrupt, demean democracy'

headlines: In boost to BJP in Odisha, former Naveen aide joins party
content: Though three-time MLA Pradeep Panigrahy is facing cases over alleged corruption and cheating, he continues to wield clout in Ganjam, BJD stronghold and Naveen’s bastion

headlines: Real estate baron Kupendra Reddy’s entry stirs Karnataka Rajya Sabha pot, Congress prepares for the heat
content: Kupendra Reddy's declared wealth of Rs 1,200 crore makes Congress side nervous in a state with history of cross-voting, and given its own past record with the businessman

headlines: West UP back on Rahul Gandhi’s Yatra map, but will skirt RLD strongholds
content: The Yatra will cover 5 districts in a day as Congress leader seeks to “save time”; will be on pause from Feb 26 to March 1 as Rahul heads to UK for lectures as part of "a long-standing commitment"

headlines: DMK’s offer to Kamal Haasan: A Lok Sabha seat or Rajya Sabha berth
content: If Kamal Haasan contests, DMK wants him to do so on its symbol, plus campaign across the state; but the actor-politician wants to stand on his party's MNM symbol

headlines: Alliance with Akhilesh up in air, Chandrashekhar Aazad gets set for solo UP run, says Opp ‘not ready to jolt BJP’
content: Amid SP’s ‘silence’ over seat-sharing, Chandrashekhar’s Azad Samaj Party is looking to contest 14 LS seats on its own, even as he is preparing to fight from Nagina

headlines: Decode Politics | Akhilesh Yadav’s ‘PDA’ pitch: Why making new friends not as easy as public display of affection
content: Angry voices from within, resignation of Swami Prasad Maurya, coalition pressures, candidate choices are all putting under strain SP’s bid to expand its vote base beyond Muslims and Yadavs, to other OBC groups and Dalits

headlines: Mayawati cuts ties with Gondwana party after MP, Chhattisgarh fiasco, to go solo in LS polls
content: BSP and GGP failed to undertake a 'new social engineering' through an alignment of Dalit-tribal voters in MP, Chhattisgarh, getting routed in Assembly polls

headlines: Today in Politics: Will they or won’t they? AAP, Congress’s Delhi dance continues
content: Plus, PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the Raisina Dialogue conference and protesting farmers are scheduled to begin their march to Delhi.

headlines: Decode Politics: Jobs to ‘BAAP’, why Tejashwi Yadav is first off the blocks in LS poll race
content: “Nitish Kumar has no new vision for Bihar. He is a man of old thoughts,” the RJD leader said Tuesday as he embarked on the 10-day Jan Vishwas Yatra from Muzaffarpur.

headlines: Third time lucky? Why this Act on Maratha quota is unlike two previous bidsSubscriber Only
content: All three moves were timed to before elections. The most recent one follows an elaborate survey of the Maratha community, which govt says will pass muster in courts

headlines: SP continues its blows on Congress, names candidates for 2 seats left for ally
content: SP announces nominees for Varanasi and Amroha, taking its list to 22, as Congress keeps waiting for seat talks to "conclude"; Shivpal replaces Dharmendra in Badaun

headlines: Why Maratha panel said quota ‘need of hour’, warned of ‘social imbalance’
content: Marathas form 27% of Maharashtra's population, 84% of them are in non-creamy layer, says panel. “Compared to OBCs, the backwardness is more pervasive in terms of penetration, further regressive in character”

headlines: Capt Amarinder Singh: ‘PM Modi wants farm stir resolution soon… Farmers must understand this has to be within national perspective’
content: 'I am all for alliance of BJP with Akalis...We should fight together in Lok Sabha polls to counter our opponents strongly,' ex-Punjab CM tells The Indian Express

headlines: Chandigarh Mayor: AAP-Congress gets post, but BJP numbers to keep chair rocky
content: After AAP councillors switched, BJP has simple majority; counts on unsteady AAP-Congress tie-up to collapse, get it needed votes to oust Kuldeep Kumar Tita

headlines: From the Urdu Press: ‘Rahul must halt Yatra, launch Cong Jodo campaign’, ‘Cynical towards farmers, govt wants privatisation in agriculture’
content: Rahul is an enthusiastic Cong worker but he does not have qualities of a successful leader, or else he would have reached out to disgruntled party leaders to check their exit, writes Urdu Times

headlines: 10 days after Jayant said joining NDA, what is BJP waiting for?
content: No word from BJP on formal alliance yet, leaders insist it is all but sealed; speculation that both sides are waiting for the farmer agitation to get resolved for maximum effect.

headlines: PDP leader and ex-J&K Dy CM attends Modi rally, says have ‘come to listen to my PM’
content: Muzaffar Hussain Baig, who took a position contrary to PDP over Article 370, refuses to confirm or deny if he would be joining BJP; says BJP will “perform well” in Kashmir in LS polls

headlines: Serial turncoat Afzal Ansari gets SP ticket now, set to contest after SC nod
content: The ‘brains’ behind gangster-brother Mukhtar Ansari of eastern UP, he is among the 11 new names announced by SP for the Lok Sabha polls

headlines: Prominent OBC face Swami Prasad Maurya now leaves SP, likely to float own party
content: Once a confidant of Mayawati, he had joined BJP and was made a minister, before quitting it for SP ahead of 2022 polls; claims he was "marginalised" over controversial remarks on Ramcharitmanas

headlines: Today in Politics: PM Modi in Jammu, will inaugurate the world’s highest railway bridge
content: Plus, Amit Shah in Rajasthan to address multiple BJP meetings, focus on three clusters

headlines: What is holding up Opposition seat-sharing deal in Maharashtra? These 9 seats, say MVA insiders
content: From urban constituencies such as Pune and Mumbai South Central to Hingoli in Marathwada, the coalition is trying to resolve differences arising out of competitive interests.

headlines: Decode Politics: As Sandeshkhali simmers, why there is unease in TMC about its political fallout
content: While Mamata Banerjee accuses the BJP of attempting to manufacture an “Adivasis versus minorities” narrative in the area, some in the TMC blame the party’s strategy for the situation it finds itself in

headlines: Five takeaways from key BJP conclave: Modi as poll  mascot, Ram Mandir plank, slamming Cong, INDIA
content: PM told National Council that BJP workers should see the 370-seat target not just as a number but as their tribute to Jana Sangh founder Syama Prasad Mookerjee

headlines: In fresh jolt to INDIA, Akhilesh skips Rahul Yatra  in Amethi as SP raises seat-sharing heat on Cong
content: Akhilesh also set to skip Yatra in Raebareli, even as SP unilaterally announces nominees for 11 more seats, taking total number of its candidates to 27

headlines: As Kamal Nath ponders next move, the up and mostly downs of his time as MP Congress chief
content: The former Madhya Pradesh CM was credited with uniting a faction-ridden state unit and steering it to victory in the 2018 Assembly polls. But that proved to be a short-lived success.

headlines: Today in Politics: SC to hear Sharad Pawar’s plea against Ajit; Rahul v/s Smriti in Amethi
content: Plus, the top court will also hear a PIL relating to allegations of sexual assault on women by members of the ruling TMC in Bengal’s Sandeshkhali

headlines: ‘Akhilesh Yadav ignoring PDA’: 5-time MP Saleem Shervani resigns as SP general secretary
content: Senior leader Swami Prasad Maurya had quit the party over the issue and ally Pallavi Patel said she would not vote for the SP’s RS nominees.

headlines: New TN Cong chief K Selvaperunthagai: Tamil nationalism to Dalit activism to Kharge’s pick
content: Sriperumbudur MLA is first Cong leader from Dalit community since L Ilaya Perumal in 1979 to be appointed TNCC president, edging out two party leaders close to Rahul Gandhi.

headlines: Bihar Dalit firebrand and disqualified CPI-ML (Liberation) MLA known for ‘Sadak Pe School’ campaign: Who is Manoj Manzil?
content: First-time MLA from Bhojpur has been disqualified from Assembly following his conviction in a murder case; CPI (ML) Liberation has called it an act of ‘judicial massacre and part of feudalistic conspiracy.'

headlines: Eye on LS polls, Telangana Cong looks to double down on schemes after caste survey
content: Stepping up BC outreach, Revanth Reddy govt pledges to use survey data to benefit them socially, economically and educationally besides increasing their quota in local bodies

headlines: Today in Politics: Modi to set BJP’s LS poll roadmap at key conclave; farmers up ante on eve of talks with Centre
content: Jharkhand CM Champai Soren, state Cong president to meet Kharge as eight Cong MLAs disgruntled over Cabinet induction arrive in Delhi; Cong also braces for Kamal Nath's exit

headlines: As farmers direct heat at the Centre, AAP’s Punjab govt catches a break
content: The protests take heat off for now on the Mann govt, which has been struggling against agitations on several fronts.

headlines: In Kamal Nath, BJP sees a chance to strike deep at Congress heart, and pocket
content: A second former CM to leave within days would not be a good look for Congress, which will also miss the veteran's fund-raising skills, and lose further ground in a key state

headlines: Rahul Gandhi visits Kashi Vishwanath, maintains silence on Gyanvapi
content: Congress charges cameras were not allowed to accompany Rahul during Vishwanath Temple visit

headlines: Decode Politics: Behind Kejriwal’s repeated trust vote moves, targeting BJP, House muscle-flexing
content: During all his three trust votes in his third term so far, Delhi CM has claimed their trigger was BJP's 'Operation Lotus'; BJP has called them 'ploy to divert attention from corruption charges'

headlines: On Kamal Nath, Congress puts up brave face, but state unit has some anxieties
content: Nath was projected as the CM face in Madhya Pradesh and enjoyed almost full autonomy in decision making – from ticket distribution to the campaign strategy – but the party’s final tally suggested the gamble had not paid off.

headlines: Gandhi loyalist Kamal Nath, his MP-son likely to leave Congress for BJP
content: Amid growing buzz over his move, Kamal Nath reaches Delhi from Chhindwara, tells reporters, 'Why are you getting excited. If there is something like that I will inform you first'

headlines: Nadda, Rajnath lead BJP chorus: Modi will be back for third term
content: PM tells party 370 seats will be tribute to Syama Prasad Mookerjee

headlines: Battle lines being drawn for Ajit Pawar wife vs Supriya Sule in Baramati: Who is Sunetra Pawar?
content: A social worker, Sunetra has never contested an election, but has remained active in campaigning for her husband in the Pawar family stronghold in Assembly polls

headlines: Punjab CM in new role: How Mann has risen  as unlikely mediator in Centre-farmers talksSubscriber Only
content: Invited to mediate with Centre by farm unions given his anti-BJP credentials, CM Mann has been nudging both sides towards a resolution, while flagging his own concerns

headlines: Rise of new JMM face: First-time minister Basant Soren set to lead party in LS polls with brother Hemant in jail
content: Youngest son of Shibu Soren and Dumka MLA, Basant, who heads JMM’s youth wing, would spearhead the party’s poll campaign especially in Santhal Parganas

headlines: As Jayant leads RLD to BJP, west UP waits for clearer signs to follow him
content: No clarity on seats yet, Muslim base wary, farm protest stirring, RLD supporters watch out for deal Jayant gets; Bharat Ratna to Charan Singh welcome but not the clincher

headlines: Today in Politics: BJP National Council meeting set to begin in Delhi, set tone for LS poll campaign
content: Plus, the Delhi Assembly will discuss a vote of confidence tabled by Arvind Kejriwal; comes on the day a city court hears a case against the CM for skipping ED summons

headlines: Modi’s popularity soars, why he needs to listen to voices that want to be heard, north to east to southSubscriber Only
content: On the cusp of a likely third term, PM has the space to ensure that an already polarised polity doesn't open new fault lines.

headlines: Decode Politics: As cross-voting cloud looms on Rajya Sabha polls, how open ballot came up as solution
content: MLAs choosing Upper House MPs would have to show their vote to party representatives, but that hasn't checked cross-voting. This time, the possibility could arise in Karnataka, UP, Himachal

headlines: ‘IT penalty of Rs 135 cr on us … For what? Doesn’t IT want democracy to survive?’: CongressSubscriber Only
content: Rajya Sabha MP Vivek Tankha who represented the Congress before the Income Tax Appellate Tribunal on Friday after its accounts were frozen says, “If you are choking us completely, then the Congress will be out of elections … I asked whether the IT Department doesn’t want democracy to survive in India.”

headlines: Election bonds order: A look at other Modi govt policy decisions challenged in SC, and what followedSubscriber Only
content: These include Aadhaar, CAA, Article 370, NCT powers, NJAC, demonetisation, and others. In most cases, SC has ruled in the govt's favour

headlines: Two senior leaders not in race, is BJP toning down its Lok Sabha poll plans for TN?
content: Annamalai says he was never in contention, nor was L Murugan, just renominated to RS. But expectant party leaders say TN state chief should have led by example

headlines: Farm stir upsets SAD, BJP reconciliation plan, Akalis press pause, BJP’s rural push takes a hit
content: The outcome of Centre-farm unions talks would have a crucial bearing on SAD-BJP’s realliance bid for LS polls, with Akalis deciding to give primacy to the cause of farmers, their core base.

headlines: How 17th Lok Sabha performed: One-third of Bills passed under an hour, record suspensions, lengthy interruptions
content: The Lower House held 274 sittings in five years, the fewest for a full-term Lok Sabha. It also referred 16% of Bills to standing committees for scrutiny, well below the 60% and 71% when UPA 1 and 2 governments were in power.

headlines: Key RJD backroom operator, Tejashwi Yadav’s advisor now RS nominee: Who is Sanjay Yadav?
content: RJD insiders say Sanjay, who was introduced to Tejashwi by Akhilesh Yadav, played a crucial role in the party’s success in the 2015 Bihar Assembly polls

headlines: Former CECs welcome SC judgment on electoral bonds, say ECI’s concerns addressed
content: Former CEC O P Rawat, who was the Election Commissioner in 2017, had raised concerns with the government when the scheme was being discussed. He said Thursday's judgment has “addressed all concerns of the EC about shell companies and loss-making firms funnelling money through electoral bonds”.

headlines: Electoral bonds and regional parties: TMC, DMK getting donations only via bonds since 2022-23, BJD from a year ago
content: TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh said, “People have a right to know the source of funds received through electoral bonds. We welcome the Supreme Court’s decision. We feel that one political party, which had introduced the electoral bonds, will cease to exist.”

headlines: As farm protests continue, BJP feels the heat in Punjab, its leaders choose silence
content: Former CM Amarinder Singh and Sunil Jakhar had taken vocal positions in support of the farmers in 2020 when they were in Cong, but haven't been heard this time, now that they are in BJP; party's farmer leaders urged it to lend a ear to protesters

headlines: BJP’s surprise RS pick in UP, Sanjay Seth: Realty tycoon, ex-aide of Mulayam, Akhilesh
content: By fielding ex-SP treasurer as its 8th candidate, BJP has forced an election, even though it lacks eight votes, which opens possibility of cross-voting.

headlines: Today in Politics: With Rahul and Tejashwi set to address a rally together in Bihar, what to watch out for
content: Meanwhile, PM Narendra Modi will launch and unveil development projects worth more than Rs 26,000 crore in Rajasthan and Haryana, including an AIIMS in Rewari.

headlines: Himachal: Amid rumblings in Congress over Abhishek Singhvi, BJP names candidate for lone RS seat
content: The opposition BJP quickly moved in fielding Harsh Mahajan, a former Congress veteran. Mahajan joined the BJP in 2022 ahead of the Assembly elections. He was then the working president of the Himachal Pradesh Congress.

headlines: 10 seats, 11 candidates: In UP, RS poll heat rises as BJP, SP join numbers war
content: Compounding SP’s troubles, its ally Apna Dal (Kamervadi) leader Pallavi Patel said she won't vote in the polls, citing SP's 'negligence of PDA communities'

headlines: NC digs in heels on seat-sharing in J&K, Congress faces heat from another INDIA ally
content: After Farooq Abdullah says will contest Kashmir polls alone, Omar clarifies only Jammu seats are on the table for talks, PDP hopes “responsible parties” will rise above differences

headlines: Electoral bonds order: BJP says its only aim was ‘transparency’, believes won’t influence polls
content: “Perfect has become the enemy of good”, says the party, asks how reverting to old practice of cheques is better; adds even parties whose support is waning have got funds via electoral bonds

headlines: Electoral bonds order: Among petitioners, Congress woman leader who wields PILs ‘to ensure justice’
content: A trained dentist and MP Mahila Congress general secretary, Jaya Thakur has filed PILs on issues ranging from allegations against Adani Group to sanitary pads for school students, as well as against own party leaders.

headlines: Electoral bonds order: Opposition hopes for revival riding on corruption charge against govt
content: Parties welcome order, believe the details of donors and recipients will help it build a quid pro quo case against the Modi govt.

headlines: Kapil Sibal interview: ‘Govt cannot set aside electoral bonds judgment with an Ordinance … No law can set aside an SC verdict’Subscriber Only
content: "The scheme is perhaps the biggest scam in the history of India ... The Opposition may also be affected but the scheme was not brought by them, the BJP brought it," says Rajya Sabha MP who was the leading advocate for petitioners in the case.

headlines: Decode Politics: What has the Opposition said on electoral bonds
content: Since the introduction of the scheme in 2018, the BJP has pitched it as a transparent solution to a corrupt electoral process. But the Opposition has been raising issues of transparency

headlines: Congress ally and Kerala MP lands in a soup over ‘surprise’ lunch with PM in Parliament
content: With RSP's Premachandran the only INDIA MP present at the lunch, CPI(M) claims lunch exposes Cong-BJP "nexus"; Premachandran accuses CPI(M) of making wild allegations with eye on Muslim vote

headlines: 57% vs 10%: BJP vs Congress share in electoral bond funds
content: With the Supreme Court striking down the scheme, analysis of declarations, SBI data show that after the big two come major regional ruling parties. NCP figures despite not being in power

headlines: As Sonia Gandhi vacates Raebareli, recent polls show Congress losing hold in seat
content: While the party has lost the LS seat only thrice, its vote share has fallen since 2014, which might prompt party to stick to a Nehru Gandhi; in Assembly polls, it has been reeling in Raebareli segments

headlines: Behind TMC’s RS picks, Abhishek game plan, stepping up women outreach, national pitch
content: By nominating Mamata Bala Thakur to RS, TMC has sought to increase legislative representation of Matua community, a key vote bank for both TMC and BJP in Bengal

headlines: As BJD backs Vaishnaw for RS polls, buzz of ‘tacit pact’ with BJP in Odisha gains pace
content: The Congress has accused the two parties of ‘running the state government in partnership’; state BJP says support will have no bearing on Assembly, LS poll fights

headlines: Today in Politics: Will farmers call off stir — all eyes on their talks with Centre; SC set for electoral bonds verdict
content: PM Modi in Doha to meet Qatari Emir days after seven out of eight former Indian Navy personnel, who were sentenced to death, were released from Qatar’s custody and brought back to India

headlines: RSS affiliate supports farmers’ demands on MSP but says against ‘violent agitation’
content: The Bharatiya Kisan Sangh had earlier advocated a law for MSP but avoids using the term, says it backs demand for ‘remunerative prices’

headlines: Sonia joins ‘outsiders’ taking Rajasthan route to Rajya Sabha in Congress; list carries Rahul, Kharge imprint
content: Cong's 10 RS nominations show accommodation of veterans as well as honouring of state leadership's wishes in some cases

headlines: 24 of 28 new faces, BJP goes in for Rajya Sabha overhaul, signals what’s coming for LS polls
content: Nadda, Vaishnaw among those repeated; party wants senior RS leaders being put in LS battle to emerge as its new faces in respective states

headlines: After Swami Maurya, SP’s Apna Dal ally speaks out over ‘sidelining’ of backwards
content: Apna Dal (K) leader Pallavi Patel announces her party won’t vote in RS polls, questions nomination of upper caste names even as SP swears by its concern for them

headlines: Jagan’s 3-capital plan stuck, Andhra hems and haws ahead of June 2 deadline on Hyderabad
content: After YSRCP leaders speak in two voices on whether Hyderabad should continue as capital, TDP says Jagan leaders seeking to protect "illegal assets” in the city

headlines: Meet key faces of farm protest 2.0: A rebel and a lone warrior
content: Sarwan Singh Pandher, the coordinator of the Kisan Mazdoor Morcha (KMM) and the Kisan Mazdoor Sangharsh Committee (KMSC), and Jagjit Singh Dallewal, the Samyukt Kisan Morcha (non-political) coordinator are leading the protests this time.

headlines: As Governors walk out of Assemblies, what has SC said on their powers
content: Court has taken up the matter at least thrice -- in 1994, regarding the Karnataka Governor; in 2016, in case of Arunachal; in 2020, for MP; and most recently over delayed Bills in Punjab, Kerala, TN

headlines: Jolt for Congress now from Assam, 2 MLAs, ‘extend support’ to BJP government
content: The two include Assam Cong working president, who is facing a Vigilance probe; CM Sarma says Assam will soon “become a state where all MLAs will support the state govt and Centre"

headlines: Congress RS name for Maharashtra is Dalit leader let down by own partymen in 2022 Council polls
content: The loss of two-time MLA and former Cabinet minister Chandrakant Handore in 2022 was seen as result of cross-voting, with hints that party had let down the Dalits

headlines: Decode Politics: Why Manipur CM is calling for  deporting post-1961 settlers, raising NRC pitch
content: The Biren Singh government and a large section of Meiteis have sought to link the continuing ethnic strife in Manipur to ‘uncontrolled illegal immigration’ from Myanmar

headlines: In new company, Nitish Kumar’s new clothes — a lighter shade of ‘secularism’
content: During Bihar trust vote, the JD(U) chief who once shunned Narendra Modi citing “politics of communalism” speaks BJP language of minority appeasement for RJD

headlines: Today in Politics: Sonia Gandhi to file RS poll nomination, INDIA alliance future hangs in the balance
content: Plus, in Odisha suspense continues over a Rajya Sabha seat and Naveen Patnaik's plans.

headlines: Unlike 2020-21, why BJP is unruffled by farmers’ protests this time around
content: BJP leaders admit that farmers attempting to make their way to Delhi makes for “bad optics”, insinuate that the protesters' intention is something else

headlines: In fresh blow to INDIA, AAP ups ante in Goa, names LS candidate from Congress stronghold
content: Cong calls AAP's move 'unilateral and premature' pointing out that South Goa is its sitting seat, AAP blames it for seat-sharing delay

headlines: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole interview: ‘None of our MLAs willfully wants to join BJP. It wants to pressure our leaders and drag them’
content: As Ashok Chavan quits the Congress to join the BJP, the Congress’s Maharashtra chief says the former CM will only get a minimal role in BJP and that the door is open for his return should he choose to reconsider his decision

headlines: Among SP’s Rajya Sabha names, ex-IAS, Akhilesh aide and rising Kayastha face
