content: Still not an official member of the party, the former bureaucrat was involved in the SP’s strategy team and helped draw up its 2022 Assembly poll manifesto

headlines: From the Urdu Press: ‘Uttarakhand UCC to test waters before national push’, ‘BJP moves leave INDIA splintered’
content: Modi govt's White Paper reflected a bid to score political points and was of a piece with its policy of targeting Congress and Nehru-Gandhi family, writes Roznama Rashtriya Sahara

headlines: Sonia Gandhi opts for Rajya Sabha, Priyanka may make poll debut from Raebareli in LS elections
content: Sonia will file her nomination papers in Jaipur on Wednesday, becoming the second member of the Nehru-Gandhi family after mother-in-law Indira Gandhi to enter the Upper House of Parliament.

headlines: AAP govts at two ends, BJP-led Haryana in middle: Farmer protest ripe for politics
content: BJP accuses AAP of “instigating” the farmers; AAP says farmer demands genuine, points out its CM Bhagwant Mann tried to mediate for peace

headlines: With Scindia driving pre-poll exodus from Cong, 300 Gwalior, Vidisha leaders cross over to BJP
content: In an attempt to shed his 'royal' tag and establish a stronger connection with voters, Scindia has been touring Gwalior region extensively ahead of LS polls

headlines: Rumblings in INDIA bloc in J&K as NC, PDP slug it out over sharing Valley seats
content: PDP wants NC to contest from Srinagar and Baramulla LS seats and leave Anantnag for it, but NC is keen to fight all three; both parties want Cong to contest Jammu seats

headlines: Jaya Bachchan set for 5th Rajya Sabha term: A look at her Parliament career till now
content: Bachchan is one of the most active parliamentarians around. She exceeds the national average in House attendance, participation, and has not missed a single sitting since the Monsoon Session in 2023.

headlines: Keeping AAP in crosshairs, Congress steps up bid to pick LS faces for all Punjab seats
content: Six sitting MPs are among candidates recommended by Punjab Cong to AICC screening committee, with the party set to select candidates on 'winnability'

headlines: BJP veteran, liked by Nitish Kumar, is new Bihar Speaker
content: Nand Kishore Yadav, who has an RSS background, is a seven-time MLA and former minister

headlines: Reeling from Sandeshkhali unrest, TMC moves to control damage as BJP, CPI(M) turn up heat
content: A month after TMC’s Sandeshkhali strongman Shahjahan absconded following attack on an ED team, local women took to the streets to demand his arrest, alleging that he and his aides had assaulted and exploited them for years.

headlines: Ashok Chavan joins exit queue, Maharashtra Congress frets about central, state leadership
content: Sanjay Nirupam says Chavan had been complaining about state leadership; former Mumbai Congress chief asks how Congress has gone from looking good in the state to this situation in months

headlines: Today in Politics: With farmers set to march to Delhi, why it is a big test for both BJP govt and INDIA bloc
content: Plus, AAP’s political affairs committee will meet in Delhi to discuss Lok Sabha election strategy and candidates for Delhi, Haryana, and Goa.

headlines: Three RJD MLAs cross-vote in Bihar trust vote, kin of two ‘bahubalis’ among them
content: While Sheohar MLA Chetan Anand is the son of former MP Anand Mohan, Mokama MLA Neelam Devi’s husband is former MLA Anant Singh. The third RJD legislator to cross-vote was five-time MLA Prahlad Yadav.

headlines: As its 2 UP MLAs make a pilgrimage to Ayodhya with Yogi, why Congress is a divided house
content: A section of party leaders in the state  want it to focus more on Dalit and minority votes to ensure that ally Samajwadi Party doesn’t get the upper hand among them

headlines: As Ashok Chavan quits Congress, a look at the three cases pending against him
content: Trial in CBI case in Adarsh scam yet to begin because of SC stay on proceedings in place since 2018, while ED has neither made any arrests in its case nor filed a chargesheet in the matter

headlines: Ashok Chavan latest blow, unease grows in Congress over BJP’s blitz, Rahul Yatra timing
content: Party is now apprehensive about the sole Rajya Sabha seat it can win in Maharashtra in the coming polls; leaders fight INDIA might get restricted to states where Cong already allied with parties.

headlines: Easy win for Nitish govt in trust vote as 3 RJD MLAs, ‘missing’ JD(U) MLAs surface on his side
content: Vote to remove RJD leader as Speaker sets the mood; NDA govt gets 129 votes in House of 243, none against as Opposition walks out

headlines: As Jayant makes NDA switch official, a history of RLD’s U-turns: BJP to SP and now back to BJP
content: Ajit Singh in 1997 founded the RLD that has been a part of both the Vajpayee and UPA-II governments and since 2019 was in alliance with the SP.

headlines: BJP bullish on Modi govt 3.0, rhetoric shows that with reforms, Hindutva to remain on agendaSubscriber Only
content: Several BJP leaders admit that the party would not slow down on its Hindutva push even if it returns to power with 370 seats – the target set by PM Modi – with noises already being made about Kashi, Mathura

headlines: Boost for BJP in J&K, days after Bill, Pahari face and ex-NC leader joins party
content: Shahnaz Ganai is a prominent voice of Pahari community, recently given ST status by Centre; Pahari support could help the BJP tilt numbers in its favour in Anantnag LS seat

headlines: Scion of old Congress family and ex-Maharashtra CM, Ashok Chavan now leaves party
content: Talks on with BJP since 2019, Chavan had been struggling to retain his stature in Congress since his LS loss that year.

headlines: Why an AAP-Congress alliance in Punjab made sense: 2022 Assembly poll numbers
content: If the Assembly results are projected to LS, the two parties could have swept all the 13 seats in the state. But 2024 is a whole new ballgame, with AAP and Congress no longer as strong, BJP no more that weak

headlines: Decode Politics: Why ST quota demand in Goa is gaining traction
content: With ST numbers rising from 500-odd in Census 2001 to 1.45 lakh in 2011, leading to influence in 4 Assembly seats, and protests for quota rising, BJP govt promises to take up demand with Centre

headlines: BJP holds out hope for AIADMK’s NDA return, but Palaniswami unmoved
content: With TN BJP chief Annamalai still the preferred choice of the party's top brass, regional party rules out rejoining NDA; insiders say focus is on building alliance with PMK and DMDK.

headlines: As SP gets ready to plug RLD-shaped hole in west UP, Congress may demand more seats
content: While some in Akhilesh Yadav’s party say RLD leaving the INDIA bloc for the NDA won’t have much of an impact, others say the party should promote its own Jat leaders.

headlines: Today in Politics: Will Jayant Chaudhary announce BJP deal on his father’s birth anniversary?
content: Plus, Bihar set for trust vote after late-night drama that saw RJD accuse police of surrounding Tejashwi Yadav’s home and trying to enter it “on any pretext”.

headlines: Back with BJP, Nitish Kumar to face floor test today, oust Speaker
content: No-confidence motion against Speaker Awadh Bihari Choudhary to be taken up before the vote

headlines: Congress to end Rahul yatra earlier than planned, skip most of west UP
content: Congress denies decision linked to reports of Jayant Chaudhary ditching INDIA for BJP, says ending yatra earlier will give Rahul Gandhi more time to campaign for LS polls

headlines: Newsmakers | TMC pulls a surprise with Sagarika Ghose in RS polls list, Matua leader too among nominees
content: While journalist-author Sagarika Ghose is likely to be the party’s voice in national media, the TMC has sent a signal to the Matuas by fielding Mamata Bala Thakur. The two renominated candidates are newspaper owner Md Nadimul Haque and former Silchar MP Sushmit Dev.

headlines: BJP in a bind as two allies stake claim to an LS seat in Maharashtra
content: The constituency in question is Shirdi, which is currently held by the Shiv Sena led by Eknath Shinde but is also being sought by Union Minister Ramdas Athawale

headlines: BJP-Akali backdoor talks fuel alliance whispers, but major hurdles remain on road to reconciliation
content: BJP’s increased expectations about seats and grassroots campaign in Akali territory since 2021 among the roadblocks

headlines: In Haryana, key Congress faces missing from LS list; Hooda, Selja leave it to high command
content: Senior leaders feel party should invite them to contest,' says AICC in-charge Deepak Babaria, as 299 ticket seekers file applications for 10 seats

headlines: Decode Politics: Why Sukhbir Badal seeks PM Modi intervention in Shinde govt’s Hazur Sahib Board rejig
content: While their alliance talks are underway, it would not be easy for SAD to join hands with BJP again without ensuring reversal of some of the changes made in Sikh institutions in BJP-ruled states.

headlines: Poised to tie up with RLD, BJP eyes Jat base consolidation, West UP booster in LS polls
content: RLD is likely to get Baghpat and Bijnor LS seats besides one RS berth and one MLC seat as part of its tie-up with BJP

headlines: Today in Politics: Will BJP join hands with OPS? Nadda visit to Tamil Nadu fuels alliance buzz
content: Many UP MLAs, MLCs are set to visit Ram Temple in Ayodhya, barring those from SP whose chief Akhilesh declines invite from CM Adityanath and Speaker Mahana

headlines: Modi played unparalleled role in uniting nation: House Chairs
content: It will give constitutional powers to future generations to take pride in its heritage: Modi

headlines: Ahead of trust vote, Bihar numbers in fine balance; but what will Jitan Ram Manjhi do?
content: The numbers remain in NDA’s favour but its majority will become wafer thin if Manjhi’s MLAs back the Mahagathbandhan. The former CM though has said he stands with PM Modi

headlines: Congress plays safe, extols Lord Ram’s values to slam govt
content: In Rajya Sabha, Congress MPs Pramod Tiwari and Randeep Surjewala said it was the Supreme Court which cleared the way for construction of the Ram Temple and the Congress respects the decision.

headlines: Kejriwal pulls curtains on INDIA in Punjab, Chandigarh; says AAP will contest all 14 seats
content: AAP chief's announcement deals another blow to the alliance ahead of LS polls, which has been reeling from exit of JD(U) in Bihar and is staring at likely switch of RLD in UP now

headlines: In Kerala, Congress puts up united face as Sudhakaran, Satheesan set off on yatra to take on CPM, BJP
content: By stepping up its protest against Centre's fiscal policies, LDF has already pitched itself as main opponent of Modi dispensation in Kerala before LS polls

headlines: Bruised by poll loss, Congress on the ropes in Madhya Pradesh, BJP looks to go in for the kill
content: As BJP focuses on Mahakaushal, Kamal Nath’s family bastion and the only LS seat Congress holds at present, Congress is fighting dented morale, simmering anger over Assembly poll ticket distribution, and despondency over 'Modi guarantees' and Ram Mandir narrative

headlines: Abhishek Singhvi interview: ‘Uttarakhand UCC’s live-in provision is surveillance by registration…directly violative of many SC judgments on privacy, autonomy & Art 21’Subscriber Only
content: ‘This UCC is actually over 80% imposition from Hindu laws of divorce, succession and guardianship,’ says CWC member; on Gyanvapi row, he says the ‘core question is whether Places of Worship Act allows removal of any place of worship on the assumed or proved ground of a prior structure existing underneath’

headlines: Decode Politics: Why Kerala finds itself in court over caste census
content: Amid growing push from Opposition on issue, LDF govt cites need for consensus, cases in SC to delay exercise to determine socially and economically backward classes

headlines: As a TMC strongman is arrested, why Mamata Banerjee’s party won’t be complaining
content: Former Bhangar MLA Arabul Islam, arrested twice earlier, was expelled from the TMC in 2014 because of two deaths in an intra-party rivalry. But he was reinstated two years later.

headlines: With Bharat Ratnas, Narendra Modi firms up a four-M Mantra – Mandal, Mandir, Market, MandiSubscriber Only
content: Karpoori Thakur, L K Advani, Narasimha Rao and Chaudhary Charan Singh plus Swaminathan cover the ground for the BJP dispensation

headlines: Today in Politics: With Parliament set to discuss Ram Temple, how will Opposition respond?
content: Plus, Amit Shah will be in Karnataka at a time when BJP-JD(S) talks are at final stage, and Bihar BJP to hold a workshop for its MLAs ahead of crucial trust vote.

headlines: BJP delighted host as after Chandrababu Naidu, ‘friendly’ Jagan comes calling
content: Even as TDP-BJP talks are on for seat-sharing, YSRCP is said to be keen on continuing its own amiable ties with the ruling party at the Centre, and is said to have conveyed the same to BJP leadership

headlines: Decode Politics: 20 days to go for state board exams, why is Tripura staring at protests
content: In its latest flip-flop, the state board exam body has again ruled out Roman script for answering Kokborok papers, a touchy issue among tribals, who see insistence on Bengali as an imposition

headlines: Message to farmers, strike at Congress, as Modi govt announces 3 more Bharat Ratnas
content: Days after honouring EBC champion Karpoori Thakur and Hindutva hero L K Advani, it awards farmer leader Charan Singh, noted agricultural scientist M S Swaminathan, and ex-PM P V Narasimha Rao, who was left fighting for space in Cong legacy

headlines: Meet the new ‘Lokpal of India’: Justice A M Khanwilkar, who penned several orders key for Modi govt
content: Shortlisted for post vacant since nearly 2 years, as SC judge, Justice Khanwilkar was part of orders decriminalising homosexuality, clearing strict provisions of PMLA and FCRA, and upholding SIT clean chit to Gujarat govt for 2002 riots.

headlines: Decode Politics: How Punjab came to be among first states to sub-categorise SCs, and has been fighting to retain it
content: A Congress govt headed by Giani Zail Singh set aside 50% of the SC quota for Valmikis and Mazhabi Sikhs in 1975; AAP govt that is in power now has argued  in SC that "it is no longer about advantaged, disadvantaged but about disadvantaged, more disadvantaged"

headlines: Bharat Ratna for P V Narasimha Rao: Congress’s Achilles heel, the PM it ‘forgot’
content: Sonia Gandhi, with whom the former PM shared a frosty relationship, says, “I welcome it. Why not?”

headlines: Bharat Ratna for Chaudhary Charan Singh: Former PM who championed farmers’ causes
content: Singh started his political career in the Congress but left the party to form the first non-Congress government in UP in 1967. He twice served as the state’s CM before becoming more involved in national politics.

headlines: ‘Maun-Mohan’, Night Watchman to ‘shining example’: PM Modi on Manmohan Singh over the years
content: Narendra Modi consistently hit out at Singh in the lead-up to the 2014 Lok Sabha elections, making his RS farewell tribute to him quite a departure. Manmohan's criticism of Modi more on policies.

headlines: ‘By fencing Myanmar border, govt will only create another Berlin Wall… For centuries, same people have inhabited both sides’: Manipur tribal forum leader
content: "We can't be under a govt that submits itself to armed militia... Numerous talks with the Centre show it is not committed to finding a solution for us... but we haven't lost faith;" Ginza Vualzong, ITLF spokesperson

headlines: Threats of ‘poaching’, Speaker yet to resign: Bihar political intrigues continue ahead of trust vote
content: RJD leader says “safe to have our Speaker” when Nitish government is precariously placed; “It is the Opposition that needs to worry about keeping its flock together,” responds BJP

headlines: Today in Politics: Will BJP pick a side in Andhra Pradesh? As Jagan arrives in Delhi, speculation swirls
content: Plus, Nirmala Sitharaman to speak in LS on the White Paper on Indian economy, and will RLD ditch INDIA alliance?

headlines: White Paper in hand, BJP lays out its gameplan: Nationwide campaign against Congress, economy to be major poll plank
content: State units of the party will highlight details from the 59-page document to underline “what went wrong in the economy during the 10 years of UPA and the efforts taken by the Modi government to put it back on track”.

headlines: RLD deal ‘almost finalised’: What BJP has offered as Jayant Chaudhary inches closer to quitting INDIA bloc
content: Senior RLD leader says the “formal announcement may happen in a day or two”, BJP refuses to give up Muzaffarnagar and Kairana

headlines: ‘Tired of waiting’ for seat-sharing with allies, AAP announces 3 candidates for Lok Sabha polls in Assam
content: Of the 14 current MPs from Assam, nine are from the BJP, three are from Congress, one is from the All India United Democratic Front, and one is an Independent.

headlines: Decode Politics: Rahul Gandhi says Modi ‘not born OBC’; BJP claims Telis notified thus under Cong Gujarat govt
content: Telis and Modh Ghanchis, the sub-group to which PM belongs, have been part of OBC list in Gujarat since 1995, included in Central list since 1999.

headlines: ‘We can’t let Indian democracy which was envisaged as a ‘Union of States’ be crippled into a ‘Union over States’: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: “BJP is trying to weaken secularism and federalism, and thereby our democracy... So democratic and secular parties have to come together... People are well aware of this"

headlines: White Paper in Parliament, why BJP is keeping guns trained on Cong: ‘Regional allies not permanent foes’
content: BJP leaders point to shrinking INDIA alliance, add that some regional parties may become overt allies and some others, "in badmouthing Congress and spoiling its chances, inadvertently act like covert allies"

headlines: Why Baba Siddique exit deals a blow to  Mumbai Congress, boosts Ajit Pawar NCP
content: Former minister and three-time Bandra West MLA Baba Siddique is also known for his influence in Bollywood; his son Zeeshan is Bandra East MLA and Mumbai Youth Cong chief

headlines: Special Category Status for Andhra: 5 years later, Jagan in Chandrababu Naidu’s shoes
content: YSRCP had stormed to power in 2019 accusing ruling TDP of not being able to fulfil the promise; now Jagan says openly that needs influence at Centre to meet the demand.

headlines: BJP-JD(S) talks in Karnataka in final lap, Kumaraswamy may get Chikkaballapur, no clarity on other Gowdas
content: A one-time MP who is currently MLA from Channapatna, Kumaraswamy is also seen as a contender from Mandya

headlines: SP MP who spoke on Gyanvapi: ‘Current politics against Muslims … Silsila of making claims on religious places should stop’
content: "Till when shall one community tolerate? ... Opposition fears upsetting other voters by raising issues of Muslims," says S T Hasan

headlines: ‘370 seats’: The numbers behind Modi’s target, BJP’s maths, Opposition’s challenge
content: The BJP, which has been on the rise since 2014, has made among its biggest gains in West Bengal, and smallest in areas with few seats or little presence. Of 133 seats it fought and lost in 2019, nearly half were in South.

headlines: Sharad Pawar back to drawing board after losing NCP to Ajit, braces for toughest battle at 83
content: Notwithstanding his faction's legal fight ahead, the immediate task before Sharad Pawar is to ready it with a new identity in two months for LS polls

headlines: Today in Politics: Vijayan Cabinet to hold protest against Modi govt at Jantar Mantar; BJP vs Cong on economy rages
content: PM Modi will address an event to commemorate 150th birth anniversary of spiritual guru Srila Prabhupada; Rahul Yatra is set to enter Chhattisgarh

headlines: Upset with Congress for skipping Ayodhya event, Jabalpur Mayor, Digvijaya aide cross over to BJP
content: In blow to MP Congress ahead of LS polls, Jabalpur Mayor close to Kamal Nath along with several party leaders join BJP in presence of CM Mohan Yadav

headlines: As Lok Sabha passes Bill giving J-K groups ST status, Pir Panjal on guard, Omar Abdullah says ‘stopped’ from visit
content: Amid apprehensions over protests by Gujjars, Bakerwals, social media posts, mobile Internet suspended in region; NC asks why Omar was “not allowed” to go to Rajouri for party meeting

headlines: RLD’s silence on meetings with BJP sets off speculation; spooks SP
content: Seat-allocation issues with SP continue; RLD chief has not been heard from on major recent issues, including Ram Temple, interim budget, UCC

headlines: Chandrababu Naidu in Delhi amid talk of TDP-BJP tie-up, top leaders count the gains
content: BJP still has options open, wants 8-10 seats while TDP reportedly offering 4-5. However, the scales are tilting towards TDP rather than its rival YSRCP for BJP in Andhra

headlines: 5 takeaways from PM Modi’s RS speech: Social justice, to state protests, cites Congress record
content: Referring to the dismissal of elected governments using Article 356 under the Congress, the PM said: “This Congress is giving us sermons on democracy and federalism!”

headlines: Jagan hopes for a govt at Centre ‘that will rely on us for support’, not have absolute majority
content: The YSRCP chief says this while talking about the long wait for special category status; remarks coincide with talk that TDP may revive its alliance with BJP

headlines: Decode Politics: Modi govt’s last move for this House is a white paper on ‘economy under it vs UPA’. So what are white papers?
content: The rules, procedures of Lok Sabha have no mention of it, but govts often table white papers in Parliament, Assemblies; Modi govt has tabled two so far, though Opposition has demanded several times on several issues

headlines: BJP claims big gains in TN as ex-MLAs, former MP join party; but most of them seen as spent forces
content: Many won during MGR time, lone ex-MP was last elected in 1980; TN BJP chief Annamalai, who called their joining sign of faith in Modi govt, says no doors closed, including to AIADMK

headlines: PM Modi quotes Nehru’s letter to CMs to say Congress against reservations. What did Nehru write?
content: "I am grieved... how far this business of reservation has gone based on communal considerations... Even promotions based sometimes on communal or caste considerations. This way lies not only folly, but disaster. Let us help the backward groups by all means, but never at the cost of efficiency," the former PM had said

headlines: Court notice to Kejriwal now in tussle with ED, here is the length and breadth of net around AAP
content: AAP chief may be running out of options on ED summons; Atishi is fourth in his govt facing central agency action; and DJB is a new battle ground

headlines: Uttarakhand set to pass UCC, numbers show a BJP on rise in the state but Congress holding on
content: BJP has dominated the 4 LS polls held in the state since it was formed in 2002, but in Assembly elections, Congress has given a closer fight in state's bipolar politics; BJP sweep has included Muslim-dominated areas

headlines: The latest Opposition leader under ED watch, Harak Rawat, is a frequent side shifter, was last in BJP
content: ED alleges irregularities during Rawat's tenure as forest minister under the previous Dhami govt, had joined Congress days after BJP removed him then for party over indiscipline

headlines: Ram temple resolution and invite put SP MLAs in a spot as cracks appear
content: UP House passed a resolution thanking PM Modi, CM Yogi for Ram Temple consecration ceremony

headlines: Decode Politics: Why there is talk of a southern alliance amid Karnataka, Kerala govts’ Delhi protests
content: The Karnataka government will protest in Delhi on Wednesday, followed by a Kerala Cabinet protest in the national Capital on Thursday.

headlines: Decode Politics: How BJP has gone slowly, steadily about a UCC, one of Sangh’s first core agendas
content: It was in 1951 when Jana Sangh was born that UCC was identified as its guiding principle. However, BJP has bided its time, ceding to coalition needs, or governance imperatives, as Advani put it; now beginning has been made with a small state

headlines: What next for Sharad Pawar? Choosing a new party name and symbol immediate task
content: The EC has asked the Pawar group to “provide three preferences” for a new name by 4 pm on Wednesday.

headlines: Today in Politics: Chandrababu Naidu likely to visit Delhi, are talks with BJP on the cards?
content: Plus, as the Siddaramaiah government prepares to stage a sit-in at Delhi’s Jantar Mantar in protest against the Centre’s fiscal policies, it raises questions about the Opposition’s strategy.

headlines: ‘Everybody is fighting separately, but sooner or later, it (a South alliance) will evolve… We are all seeing how governors, raids being used’: Priyank KhargeSubscriber Only
content: “We have been writing to Centre, no response; coming to Delhi and knocking at their doors, no response. What else do you expect us to do?” says Karnataka minister as state govt protests

headlines: To avoid OBC anger fallout, a Shinde Sena MP endorses nationwide caste census demand
content: The Shiv Sena has been in damage control mode ever since the Maharashtra govt agreed to give Marathas reservation under OBC quota

headlines: Mixing farm outreach with Hindutva, Nadda set to flag off BJP’s rural yatra from Muzaffarnagar
content: Starting from Jat-dominated west UP, hub of year-long farm stir, from February 12, BJP's nationwide yatra plans to reach 2 lakh villages ahead of LS polls

headlines: Karnataka, Kerala bring campaign against ‘financial atrocities’ of Centre to Delhi
content: TN lends support to their protests, CM Stalin seeks collective effort by all states

headlines: As Thalapathy Vijay heads for political debut, a look at why cinema, politics make a compelling script in Tamil Nadu
content: The desire for one strong, unifying leader is one draw, though experience shows voters don't go by charisma alone and only stars with a movement behind them tend to be successful

headlines: Priyanka says Modi ‘misrepresented’ Nehru speech: Here is what the late PM said
content: "Hindustan is made up of lakhs of villages, these have to rise... They will grow with your and our efforts, but at the end of the day, they will grow of their own efforts, trusting themselves”

headlines: Exam paper leaks: Mounting cases, aspirants affected, parties have made it an election issue
content: In recent polls, including Rajasthan and Telangana, it was a major poll plank. Both saw a change of government.

headlines: Behind Odisha CM Patnaik move to name new ISBT after Ambedkar, BJD’s Dalit outreach, countering Oppn
content: The new Bhubaneswar bus terminal, equipped with 'airport-like facilities', is Odisha's first major project named after Ambedkar, which will be unveiled by CM just ahead of polls

headlines: Uttarakhand’s UCC Bill targets Muslim identity, deals a blow to country’s diversity: AIMPLB
content: AIMPLB says if tribals are exempted from UCC, why same yardstick cannot be applied to Muslims; Jamaat-e-Islami Hind asks how UCC is uniform if it excludes tribals

headlines: JD(U) says ‘no political meaning’ as days after its switch, ED tightens screws against its Bihar MLC
content: Assets attached of Radha Charan Sah, who is in ED custody since last year; at the time of his arrest, JD(U) had called it political vendetta; ED says Sah part of an illegal sand mining syndicate

headlines: From the Urdu Press: ‘Gyanvapi row: but Muslims should keep seeking justice’, ‘Kharge needs to rise to stem INDIA rot’
content: "If the ED is involved in a 'witch-hunt' against the AAP leaders at the behest of their political masters, it would further damage democracy," writes Salar

headlines: Decode Politics: Behind Akhilesh’s PDA game plan against BJP, bid to rejig social math, expand vote bank
content: SP says PDA represents a 'rainbow coalition of communities' that would be more appealing to masses and help it forge a larger base beyond Yadav-Muslim loyalists

headlines: Five takeaways from Modi’s last speech in 17th LS: eyeing hat-trick to flagging Cong’s free fall
content: Setting tone for LS polls, PM not only highlighted his govt's achievements but also attacked Cong for its 'all-round failures' to project that there is no alternative to BJP

headlines: Today in Politics: Will Congress avoid the ‘binary trap’ as PM Modi steps up attack?
content: Plus, the UCC Bill is likely to be tabled in the Uttarakhand Assembly, and courts will hear petitions in the Gyanvapi dispute.

headlines: Framing LS poll battle, why PM Modi gave Congress undivided attention in House speech
content: “It was virtually his Lok Sabha poll campaign launch speech. And it was clear that he wanted to reinforce the Congress-BJP binary, the UPA-NDA binary,” says a Congress leader

headlines: TN Congress divisions in the open with campaign to drop Karti Chidambaram from Sivaganga
content: Congress’s Sivangana unit passes resolution urging high command not to renominate Karti from the seat. But objections are not new and Karti is expected to prevail given the influence of P Chidambaram.

headlines: Chhagan Bhujbal’s resignation bid over Maratha-OBC quota row brings Shinde govt rifts to the fore
content: By seizing on blowback over the coalition govt's Maratha quota move, Bhujbal is looking to emerge as the state's OBC face

headlines: BJP RS MP from UP again seeks repeal of Places of Worship Act, says ‘arbitrary’
content: 'Illogical cut-off date' affects Hindus, Sikhs, Jains, Buddhists; Modiji in Amrit Kaal can change the 'slave mentality', remove 'wedge between Hindus and Muslims', says Harnath Singh Yadav in RS Zero Hour

headlines: What PM Modi said in his final speech at the end of the last Lok Sabha: A full-majority govt carries weight
content: Claimed gains in women's representation, use of soft power in foreign policy, stand on black money and corruption, and legislation of GST, Aadhaar, EWS reservation

headlines: As PM Modi delivers last speech to 17th Lok Sabha, what he said at the start of House
content: He attacked previous govts' focus on 'the family', said his govt acknowledged contribution of all, vowed to continue corruption fight but without indiscriminate arrests, harked back to a remark by Nehru

headlines: After saying he was leaving politics, TDP Guntur MP Galla Jayadev heaps praise on PM Modi
content: The TDP leader who led his party attacks against the Modi government says the PM had ‘redefined and rediscovered civilisation’ through Ram Temple; cautions govt against threat from AI

headlines: Bihar Congress chief: ‘Nitish given time till 12th for floor test … The way BJP operates, we have to be cautious (about our MLAs)’Subscriber Only
content: “It is natural to bring all those who are against the BJP … Kushwaha, Manjhi, whoever is uncomfortable there. I think Chirag Paswan will also be uncomfortable there with Kumar’s re-entry … the doors are open,” says Akhilesh Prasad Singh

headlines: Opposition back on the drawing table in UP as BJP changes the LS poll scene with temple
content: With Varanasi order coming on top of Ayodhya, SP, Cong, BSP try to find their feet on a tightrope

headlines: Almost in oblivion to attracting rival leaders, Telangana Cong scripts turnaround
content: Former dy CM T Rajaiah is the latest BRS leader to quit and is likely to join the party next week

headlines: Congress’s UP woes mount, ex-Priyanka team member, religious leader now sings praises of PM
content: Statements of Acharya Pramod Krishnam -- the Peethadhishwar of Sambhal Kalki Dham -- follow unilateral declaration of nominees for 16 tickets by SP, including Sambhal and Lucknow, which he is eyeing

headlines: Ajit Pawar is hard-hearted, selfish and ungrateful, says Sanjay Raut after ‘last poll’ jibe at Sharad Pawar
content: Ajit Pawar had urged voters in Baramati not to fall prey to the emotional appeals of his uncle Sharad Pawar in the Lok Sabha polls.

headlines: BJP’s firm focus on Maharashtra, PM Modi set to visit state, this time in NCP bastion
content: PM Narendra Modi will be in Satara, which the BJP has never won, on February 19 to receive the Shiv Samman Puraskar. This will be his third Maharashtra visit since January.

headlines: Today in Politics: PM Modi to address Parliament, UCC Bill set to be tabled in Uttarakhand Assembly
content: As Champai Soren government in Jharkhand gets ready to face floor test, Bihar Congress MLAs sequestered in Hyderabad; SC to hear AAP plea on Chandigarh mayoral poll dispute

headlines: Amid unease about ‘BJP bid to split party’, 16 Bihar Congress MLAs flown to Hyderabad
content: BJP accuses Opposition party of treating its MLAs 'like bonded labourers', Congress says legislators will be back in Patna 'after a few days'.

headlines: From being caught in Mulayam-Mayawati tussle to Ayodhya verdict: A former UP DGP looks back on his career
content: “I was caught in the crossfire of the insidious kind between two political parties, playing their power games,” O P Singh writes in his memoir "Crime, Grime and Gumption — Case Files of an IPS Officer"

headlines: ‘Ram temple was desire of majority, no need to protest’: IUML Kerala chief faces backlash
content: Thangal, a senior member of Kerala’s influential Panakkad family, made the address at a public meeting in Malappuram on January 24, two days after the Pran Pratishtha ceremony in Ayodhya.

headlines: Biggest face in TMC star cast: Who is MP Dev Adhikari who has resigned from 3 govt panels
content: The move of the two-time MP, who represents Ghatal in Paschim Medinipur district, has sparked buzz about whether he will contest LS polls; party says “personal decision”

headlines: New worry for INDIA alliance in UP: Some in RLD unhappy about seat uncertaintySubscriber Only
content: Jayant Chaudhary-led party given seven constituencies to contest but leaders looking to get tickets want clarity about which seats are theirs

headlines: Muslim cleric faces backlash for attending Ram Mandir inauguration: Who is Imam Umer Ahmed Ilyasi?
content: All India Imam Organisation chief says he went to attend the Ram Temple consecration ceremony to express ‘paigham-e-mohabbat (message of love)’ and as part of his ‘duty to the nation’

headlines: Behind Mamata attack on Congress, fear of split in Muslim vote, bid to retain supremacySubscriber Only
content: On January 22, at TMC’s all-faith rally, Mamata urged Bengal Muslims not to ‘waste their votes’ by supporting any party other than TMC

headlines: Today in Politics: Modi to roll out Rs 11,600 cr projects in Assam; Kharge to kick off Cong’s Kerala campaign
content: Amit Shah and Nadda are holding meetings with BJP’s state core committees in Cong-ruled Telangana and Himachal respectively to firm up their strategy for LS polls

headlines: IAS transfers to governance classes for ministers: How Mohan Yadav is reshaping MP governmentSubscriber Only
content: Over two months after taking charge, Yadav reshuffled 15 IAS officers, of which five were appointed to the CM Secretariat. This development comes a week after the government transferred 18 IAS officers.

headlines: With Bharat Ratna for Advani after Karpoori, BJP message for polls clear: social justice, Hindutva
content: Accept it with utmost humility and gratitude: Advani

headlines: Silent on Naveen Patnaik rule, PM Modi targets Congress in first Odisha rally after 2019
content: Pointing out that Modi's attack on BJD govt would have boosted state BJP cadre's morale ahead of the polls, a senior BJP leader admitted that Patnaik has 'close ties' with party high command

headlines: BJP MLA who shot at Shinde Sena leader in a Thane police station: Who is Ganpat Gaikwad?
content: The conflict between BJP MLA and cable operator Ganpat and Shinde Sena strongman Mahesh Gaikwad is seen as a turf war between the two allies over control of Kalyan belt represented by CM's son in LS

headlines: D K Suresh’s ‘separate country’ remark an echo of Cong’s pro-Kannada pitch to counter BJP’s Hindutva
content: Ahead of LS polls, CM Siddaramaiah has also been targeting BJP-led Centre for 'doing injustice to Kannadigas' on flood relief, devolution of funds, and infra allocations

headlines: Long arc of Advani journey: Ayodhya Yatra to BJP architect, Vajpayee No. 2 to fade-out
content: Spearheading Ram Temple movement, Advani metamorphosed from a BJP organisation man to a mass leader, courting controversies and giving thrust to his party to burst onto national scene as Congress’s challenger

headlines: In Bharat Ratna for Advani, PM Modi pulls another aceSubscriber Only
content: Modi govt’s previous 6 Bharat Ratnas, in nearly 10 yrs in power, have included Karpoori Thakur, Madan Mohan Malviya, Vajpayee, Pranab Mukherjee, Bhupen Hazarika, Nanaji Deshmukh

headlines: Ticket allocation a mess 5 years ago, why Congress has placed faith in a new system in Odisha
content: Before the 2019 LS polls, half a dozen Congress candidates pulled out after the party officially announced their names, damaging its chances even before the contest began.

headlines: Today in Politics: For INDIA alliance, Bengal troubles deepen but can Congress and TMC patch up?
content: Plus, as Uttarakhand prepares to implement UCC, a look at why it is important for BJP; and PM Modi to visit Sambalpur in Odisha

headlines: Newsmakers | The experts behind Uttarakhand UCC draft: Meet the five who drew it upSubscriber Only
content: The committee conducted a mammoth public outreach for 20 months. The report submission was delayed because the document, originally in English, had to be translated into Hindi.

headlines: Gyanvapi row: Muslim outfits question hurry shown in initiating puja, to approach President
content: “The District Judge's decision... is highly questionable, especially when it was the judge’s last day in office. Equally concerning is the unilateral disclosure of the ASI report, causing turmoil in society. Importantly, this report is merely a claim,” the leaders said in a joint statement.

headlines: Mission accomplished in Bihar, BJP’s eyes will be on Maharashtra nextSubscriber Only
content: BJP has dealt a blow to INDIA, with a diminished Nitish posing little challenge; meanwhile, in Maharashtra, the game is on as Maratha quota promise changes the ground situation

headlines: Prashant Kishor: Rahul Yatra worst timing… commander doesn’t leave HQ when his battalion at war
content: Prashant Kishor at Express Adda: "Never underestimate the Opposition in India. Opposition parties or formations could be weak, but not Opposition... But they have not utiliised the opportunies given to them."

headlines: ‘Congress may not even win 40 Lok Sabha seats this time,’ says Mamata Banerjee, questions Rahul Yatra
content: Day after Rahul again reaches out, TMC chief says Bharat Jodo Nyay Yatra was just “creating a stir” among Muslims, like BJP was doing among Hindus. “What should secular parties like us do?”

headlines: Decode Politics: As Kerala Governor Arif Mohd stages protest, gets Central security, what do rules say
content: Kerala govt has called the move "strange", but while state is responsible for security of the Governor, Centre has the authority to provide security depending on threat perception

headlines: EXCLUSIVE | Ban polygamy, exempt tribals, fix marriage age: Uttarakhand UCC draft
content: Not targeting anyone, hope it’s a model for other States: Dhami; Bill in state Assembly next week

headlines: CPI(M): ‘Won’t carry the dead weight of TMC … welcome Mamata wanting to get out of INDIA bloc’
content: 'Mamata Banerjee gave space to the BJP in West Bengal ... TMC can never fight an ideological war against it,' says CPI(M)’s West Bengal state secretary Md Selim

headlines: As ‘troubles’ from state and Centre ‘wear out’ Guntur MP Galla Jayadev, TDP stares at big loss
content: Head of Rs 5,300-cr Amara Raja Group, Jayadev says “can't remain silent forever seeing this oppression”, vows to return with “double the intensity, like Shri Ram”

headlines: As Stalin, EPS trade fireworks over CAA row, Tamil Nadu faultlines flare ahead of LS polls
content: Reeling from shrinking space in Dravidian politics and loss of minority support, AIADMK distances itself from BJP, saying it won't allow CAA to harm Muslims and Lankan Tamils

headlines: Who is Jharkhand’s new CM Champai Soren? Statehood movement veteran, close Shibu Soren aide
content: Though seen as an accessible leader known to help people in need, the veteran JMM leader's critics point out his flaws as an administrator.

headlines: Prashant Kishor Express Adda Highlights: ‘Find no logic in Rahul Gandhi doing Yatra from Manipur 2 months ahead of Lok Sabha polls’
content: Prashant Kishor has had a ringside view of political power, having worked with Narendra Modi, Rahul Gandhi, Nitish Kumar, Mamata Banerjee, Arvind Kejriwal, M K Stalin, Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy and Uddhav Thackeray.

headlines: A short history of JMM: From start in 1973 to leading Jharkhand statehood movement, the journey of Soren’s party
content: The Jharkhand Mukti Morcha began as an alliance between a Kurmi outfit, Santhals led by Shibu Soren, and a Marxist organisation. It first came to power in the state in 2005.

headlines: Decode Politics: Why Mumbai civic body polls have been hanging fire for two years
content: There has been a perception in political circles that the delay in BMC polls betrayed NDA's 'lack of confidence' in ousting Uddhav Sena from BMC ahead of LS and Assembly polls

headlines: ‘By the time Gyanvapi matter reaches SC… puja would have gone on, influence case. This is all a plan,’ says AIMPLB
content: “All Opposition parties are opportunist, fear Hindus will get upset if they say anything… You should speak about insaaf… Opting for silence is not a solution”

headlines: Today in Politics: Jharkhand’s new CM Champai Soren to take oath; TMC, AAP in protest mode
content: Hemant Soren’s plea against arrest before Supreme Court, and will Congress break its silence on Gyanvapi issue?

headlines: As puja held in Gyanvapi mosque cellar, Congress keeps mum
content: Congress maintains silence even as SP and RJD speak up. "What we are seeing now is a concerted effort to go beyond due process ..," says Akhilesh Yadav.

headlines: Who is Jharkhand Governor CP Radhakrishnan? Former Tamil Nadu BJP chief was known as ‘right man in wrong party’
content: Even DMK rivals acknowledged his qualities as BJP leader, two-time Coimbatore MP; but his year-long tenure in Ranchi Raj Bhavan has been, at best, testy

headlines: Wait gets longer for JMM-Cong in Jharkhand, Governor yet to take a call on Champai as CM
content: Jharkhand Governor C P Radhakrishnan met legislators at 5.30 pm and told them he needs more time to revert to their proposal to appoint Champai Soren as leader of the legislature party

headlines: As Jharkhand hits turbulence again, numbers put BJP mostly in pilot’s seat
content: BJP has dominated LS polls in state, and been ahead for the large part in hung Assembly results; the state’s only CM to complete a term has also been BJP's Raghubar Das. Hemant Soren’s arrest comes when INDIA yet to finalise seat-share here

headlines: Decode Politics: As Jharkhand Governor drags issue, why he doesn’t have many options
content: Governor C P Radhakrishnan yet to take a call a day after Hemant Soren resigned as CM; in contrast, Nitish Kumar took oath as CM, heading the NDA front within three hours of quitting Mahagathbandhan

headlines: Interim budget magnifies PM Modi’s ‘social justice’ theme, gives a counter secularism pitch
content: After poor, women, youth, farmers identified by the PM as “four biggest castes for me”, Sitharaman calls their welfare the government's “highest priority”, cutting across strata, geography

headlines: Modi govt shows its pre-poll confidence, no populist measures in interim budget
content: Hoping to return to power, Sitharaman said in the full Budget in July, “our government will present a detailed road map for our pursuit of Viksit Bharat”.

headlines: Pre-poll interim budget: Modi govt sticks to tradition, no surprises like 2019
content: Had made two major annnouncements in budget just before 2019, on PM Kisan, monthly pension

headlines: Hemant Soren’s video message moments before arrest: ‘Bid to make Jharkhand a victim of political conspiracy like Bihar’
content: “The parcel of land for which I am being arrested has no links to me. I am being arrested based on fake documentary evidence,” says former Jharkhand CM.

headlines: How Places of Worship Act was debated in Parliament:  ‘Foreclosing future rows’, ‘why Ayodhya only exception’
content: BJP side was led by Jaswant Singh, who claimed issue fell under state list, as Advani walked out; even those who supported Bill, including ruling Congress MPs, asked why J&K was kept out

headlines: Masih as ‘BJP messiah’: Meet presiding officer at centre of Chandigarh mayoral tussle
content: A prominent face of the BJP's minority wing in Chandigarh, was seen sharing stage when Congress councillor switched to BJP leading up to the poll

headlines: Hanuman flag row: JD(S) behind it, BJP hopes to plant feet in Old Mysore
content: Caste, rather than communal, politics is the hallmark of this region, unlike coastal belt. But BJP has already got a foot in the door in the Vokkaliga-dominated area via JD(S)

headlines: Today in Politics: All eyes on Modi govt 2.0’s last Budget; suspense over Jharkhand Governor’s move on new CM
content: FM Sitharaman’s Budget speech is expected to showcase achievements of Modi govt over the past decade; interim Budget may provide various key measures for farmers and women

headlines: Can be ‘vinamra’, not ‘laachar’: says Congress UP in-charge in message to SP, hints at options
content: Avinash Pandey says SP move that has left Cong workers confused, could be BJP ploy to divide INDIA; SP spokesperson confirms announcement, says it's as per discussions

headlines: Hemant Soren’s succession plan stalled, JMM-Congress coalition asks: ‘What is the Governor waiting for?’
content: Congress says Governor didn’t give them time to meet; ex-BJP leader calls for short-term President’s Rule

headlines: INDIA bloc rattled again, unsure if ‘BJP vendetta’ has echo on poll street
content: This comes days after Nitish Kumar’s JD(U) walked out of the INDIA bloc and returned to the NDA, stunning the Opposition parties.

headlines: An arrest long in the making, Hemant Soren under central agencies’ scanner since 2020
content: The JMM leader has been dogged by central agencies in several cases, from money laundering to illegal mining, since coming to power after the 2019 Jharkhand Assembly polls. Soren claims he is being targeted because he is not aligned with “any political party at the Centre”

headlines: Nitish Kumar hits back, slams Rahul Gandhi’s ‘faltu baat’ on caste survey, Tejashwi for jobs claim
content: In first such remarks against former partners, the JD(U) leader says he held meetings as far back as 2019 and 2020 (in his earlier stint in NDA) on caste census

headlines: In Kerala, BJP’s Christian outreach gets a booster as P C George merges outfit with it
content: A seven-time legislator at the centre of several rows in recent years over his anti-Muslim tirades, George has been close to the Sangh Parivar

headlines: Decode Politics: ED at his heels, what are the options before Hemant Soren
content: As Soren's sister-in-law Sita comes out to stake her claim for CM, while his wife's election faces challenges, the JMM is weighing pros and cons

headlines: As INDIA tie-up, Chandigarh mayor post hang on 8 ‘invalid’ votes, who holds them so — and how
content: Blank, spoiled ballot, one marked in violation of rules, or one marked twice are some of the grounds on which a vote can be declared invalid

headlines: No let-up in INDIA’s Bengal troubles: Mamata lashes out at Cong, CPM; Cong claims Rahul Yatra ‘attacked’, backtracks
content: On a tour of Malda, TMC supremo reiterates her offer of 2 Lok Sabha seats to Congress, asserts she can't work with CPI(M), accuses the parties of "clearing the ground" for Bengal

headlines: Decode politics: Tribals key, how Naveen govt doing damage control over law, unveiling promises in Odisha
content: In 2019 Lok Sabha and Assembly polls, the tribal reserved seats were almost equally split between BJD and BJP. From MSP for produce to protection of language, BJD govt rolls out plans

headlines: Behind CM Revanth Reddy push for Gaddar statue, bid to claim Dalit icon, wrest Telangana sentiment from BRS
content: To honour legacy of key face of Telangana statehood movement, Cong govt allots land at Tellapur near Hyderabad to install the balladeer’s statue

headlines: BJP leaders claim success in stifling Rahul Yatra in Assam, ensuring it did not gain momentum in NE
content: Fear was Rahul rallying Assam's substantial minority population behind Yatra, coasting on this through Bengal, Bihar; Congress counters that BJP attacks only helped propel Yatra

headlines: Ex-Assam Youth Congress chief targets Rahul,  flags Yatra ‘snub’ as ‘trigger’ for switch to BJP
content: Angkita Dutta, who was expelled from Cong after accusing IYC chief Srinivas of 'harassment', says she could not get an audience with Rahul when his Yatra crossed Sivasagar

headlines: Today in Politics: Hemant Soren to appear before ED, Chandigarh mayoral poll dispute in court
content: Plus, the last session of the 17th Lok Sabha is set to begin, and the Congress’s yatra will be back in Bengal amid worsening ties between the party and Mamata Banerjee.

headlines: SP blindsides Congress with second surprise within days, names 16 Lok Sabha candidates
content: "You should ask the SP leadership why they have cheated us like this,” says a Congress leader; SP responds: “No one has been kept in the dark”

headlines: Babulal Marandi: ‘If a CM (like Soren) runs from officers, ED or CBI, what hope can you have of him saving state interest?’
content: 'If a CM is missing for 40 hours...question will arise as to why he is running away...What is the need to hide?' asks Jharkhand BJP chief in an interview with The Indian Express

headlines: ‘Maratha notification will not hit OBC quota… it remains untouched’: Rashtriya OBC Mahasangh chief
content: Babanrao Taywade says his organisation had "succeeded" as it had got the government to ensure "no quota from OBC pie"; says they will organise a campaign for a caste census

headlines: Rahul Gandhi breaks silence on Nitish Kumar, says he went to BJP as he was opposed to caste survey
content: Claims they forced Nitish to do the caste survey; Mahagathbandhan puts up a big show in Bihar though RJD leaders Lalu, Tejashwi skip due to ED summons

headlines: Rajasthan minister who has called for a hijab ban in schools: Who is Kirodi Lal Meena?
content: The state Cabinet Minister, next only to the CM and Deputy CMs in the government hierarchy at present, was one of the most vocal critics of the Ashok Gehlot administration and regularly hit the streets in protest

headlines: Decode Politics: Why with Chandigarh mayor win, BJP deals INDIA another blow
content: Congress, AAP had billed it as first poll tie-up of INDIA parties; two parties left crying foul as BJP retains its hold on the civic body despite being 5 short in numbers

headlines: From the Urdu Press: ‘Nitish switch sets stage for Tejashwi time’, ‘INDIA bloc loses the plot, from Bengal to Punjab’
content: 'Are the Maharashtra authorities bent on sending out a message that the state has also adopted the bulldozer culture? If this is the case, it is unfortunate,' writes Inquilab

headlines: With hijab remarks, first-time Rajasthan BJP MLA Balmukundacharya notches up another row
content: Mahant of popular Hathoj Dham temple, he stirs a row asking school authorities to prevent students from wearing the hijab at government schools. Last year, he targeted meat vendors in Jaipur, saying this is “Apara Kashi, not Karachi”

headlines: Tamil star ‘Thalapathy’ Vijay set to launch political party, eye on 2026 TN Assembly polls
content: Seen as next only to Rajinikanth in popularity, Vijay's fan group is being converted into a party that will be registered with the EC “sometime around next week”

headlines: As ED questions Tejashwi, top RJD leaders huddle in Patna, skip Rahul’s Purnia rally
content: Top RJD leaders have decided to stay put in Patna in view of the ED’s questioning of Lalu and Tejashwi

headlines: Mani Shankar Aiyar’s profile of Rajiv Gandhi as a ‘misunderstood PM’: Babri to Shah Bano, Bofors to Punjab, Assam accords
content: In his book, Aiyar says Rajiv lacked the “guile, deviousness and deceit which may have helped him become a more long-lasting PM”, and says his “political advisers often led him up the garden path... for which he of course had only himself to blame”

headlines: Jagadish Shettar interview: ‘When I left BJP, it was due to some people (B L Santhosh) … things have changed since Vijayendra took over’
content: "Within the (Lingayat) community too, there is a feeling that Modi’s leadership should continue and that there would be confusion if I remained in the Congress," says former Karnataka CM who rejoined BJP last week

headlines: Nitish exit sets off INDIA worry in UP as SP fears setback to Akhilesh’s non-Yadav OBC outreach
content: Bihar CM’s move to ally with BJP may hit SP bid to woo Kurmis, which is a part of Akhilesh's targeted base of PDA or 'Pichchde (backwards), Dalits and Alpsankhyak (minorities)'

headlines: Hemant Soren back in Ranchi, meets MLAs with wife; ED seizes cash, SUV
content: Marandi had led the attack on Soren through the day. “The Chief Minister of our state has been missing for the last 40 hours due to fear of the central agencies and has again run away, hiding his face,” he had posted on X.

headlines: In shadow of Nitish exit, Congress eyes ‘show of strength’ at Rahul’s Purnea rally as INDIA totters
content: Refraining from commenting on Nitish's switch, Rahul continues his caste census pitch during Yatra, even as Abhishek Banerjee turns up heat on Cong

headlines: MP Assembly poll rout aftermath: Congress leaders come to blows over ‘Digvijaya Singh role’
content: Congress issues show cause notice to the two leaders, questions also raised about Digvijaya blaming EVMs for poll loss

headlines: Today in Politics: Big day for INDIA bloc — can it score its first victory over BJP?
content: While AAP and Congress take on BJP in Chandigarh mayoral polls, the alliance will look to send out a message through a show of strength in Bihar’s Purnea, and hold crucial seat-sharing talks in Maharashtra.

headlines: Cometh elections, cometh CAA promise: Union MoS says to be implemented ‘in a week’
content: Shantanu Thakur, who belongs to Bengal’s Matua community which will benefit from CAA, talks of a Feb enactment, as does BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari

headlines: Amid INDIA’s Bihar gloom, a Tamil Nadu cheer: ‘Like-minded’ DMK agrees to 9 seats for Congress
content: Congress had won eight of nine seats it contested in 2019; some constituencies may see adjustments

headlines: Polls to 56 Rajya Sabha seats up next in Feb end, INDIA has some good news: no further slide likely
content: BJP’s recent Assembly election wins are unlikely to change composition much in Upper House where NDA has 109 members, INDIA 89; biggest loser to be BRS

headlines: Navjot Sidhu back on familiar self pitch, Congress fears hit wicket
content: The former Amritsar MP's solo events are rocking Congress boat just when its Punjab chief Raja Warring and LoP Partap Bajwa were steadying it, having managed to reduce friction

headlines: Congress leaders named for first time in Chhattisgarh FIRs are both close to its ex-CM Bhupesh Baghel
content: Amarjeet Bhagat served as the former minister for food, civil supplies and consumer protection; U D Minj is a former MLA from Kunkuri seat

headlines: Bihar ‘settled’, BJP zeroes in on key swing states Maharashtra, Karnataka, Bengal for LS pollsSubscriber Only
content: With the memory of its 2004 loss seared into memory, the party does not want to take anything for granted as last week’s developments in Patna illustrate.

headlines: Shivanand Tiwari: ‘With Nitish with us, we had a clear advantage. But now, it is very tough… (On job front) Tejashwi has clearly scored over Nitish’
content: 'Tejashwi has evolved as a very mature leader... While he has drawn heavily from his father Lalu Prasad's social justice theme, he has very smartly woven development politics into it,' RJD veteran tells The Indian Express

headlines: CPM warms up as TMC distances itself from Rahul Yatra via Bengal
content: The Left party confirms greater participation of heavyweights, youth leaders in Yatra second phase through minority-dominated Malda, Murshidabad districts, where both parties have electoral stakes

headlines: Decode Politics: As OBC protests swell over Maratha quota, why BJP has most to lose
content: Party has managed to build an OBC base for itself, in a state where they number over half the population. Plus, any gains from Maratha promise is likely to be cornered by Shinde Sena

headlines: In Telangana, why some BRS MLAs’ meetings with CM Revanth Reddy have sparked a buzz
content: Five BRS MLAs have met the CM over the past week, including one who is eyeing the Medak LS seat from where former CM KCR may also contest.

headlines: As Akhilesh offers Congress 11 LS seats, numbers show why SP is INDIA pivot in UP
content: If 2022 Assembly polls are a basis, INDIA parties would come ahead of NDA in only 23 of UP's 80 LS seats, with Cong making a difference in just 3; BSP's addition, should it happen, could be a game changer

headlines: In Karnataka’s Lingayat belt, BJP gets Lok Sabha poll headstart by Jagadish Shettar return
content: BJP has now got more options to pick strong faces in Belagavi, Dharwad and Haveri in north Karnataka, with Shettar set to contest from any of these seats

headlines: Lok Sabha polls on the horizon, new CMs focus on welfare push: All that they have announced
content: From monthly stipends for the poor and elderly to farm sops and housing funds, the governments of Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, and Telangana have announced several welfare schemes since coming to power in December

headlines: As Congress hopes for more, SP first family fixes its LS seats, Akhilesh set for Kannauj
content: Wife Dimple and uncle Shivpal are likely to contest from the SP bastions of Mainpuri and Azamgarh, respectively.

headlines: Decode Politics: As ULFA formally disbands, tracing its nearly half-century journey, with some miles to go
content: The pro-talks faction that signed a peace accord with the government last month wrapped up, admitting they were doing so "without attaining our objective" but being left with "no option". Meanwhile, the Paresh Baruah faction holds out.

headlines: Passed over for Rajasthan CM post, BJP warms up to ‘absent’ Vasundhara Raje before Lok Sabha polls
content: After first-time MLA Bhajan Lal Sharma was named as CM, Vasundhara Raje had distanced herself from the party, skipping three key events during the first month of his tenure

headlines: Kejriwal unveils split Haryana strategy: AAP to contest Assembly polls solo, Lok Sabha seats with INDIA
content: AAP chief's announcement came days after state Cong leader Bhupinder Hooda said he was not in favour of an alliance with AAP for LS polls

headlines: Hoping to regain Odisha ground, Cong ups its game:  Raking up ‘BJD-BJP nexus’ to inducting ex-leaders
content: AICC chief Kharge is to address a rally Monday in a bid to galvanise party workers, while Rahul Yatra will enter the state on February 4 to traverse several districts.

headlines: Today in Politics: PM Modi to hold ‘Pariksha Pe Charcha’; Rahul Yatra in Bihar amid INDIA crisis
content: Staying away from Rahul Yatra in her state, CM Mamata Banerjee is undertaking her own tour of eight districts, mostly in north Bengal, to attend public programmes

headlines: RJD, Congress to scout for new political equations
content: Sources said the RJD, the senior partner in INDIA bloc in Bihar, is already looking at leaders and smaller parties within and outside NDA that haven’t had very cordial relations with Nitish Kumar in the past.

headlines: K C Tyagi: ‘Nitish walked out of INDIA as Cong conspired to finish off regional parties’Subscriber Only
content: 'Slowly everyone will come out (of INDIA bloc)... there will be no alliance between Congress and Mamata (in Bengal), SP (in UP)... Not even in Tamil Nadu (with DMK),' JD(U) political advisor tells The Indian Express

headlines: Nitish Kumar’s words that may haunt him now: ‘NDA has no vision’ to ‘BJP will be finished in Bihar’ to caste census
content: Backing Opposition's demand for a statement by PM Modi on Manipur violence, Nitish said in July last year, “Such incidents are highly condemnable. The Prime Minister must issue a statement in Parliament.”

headlines: Nitish Kumar sworn in as Bihar CM for the 9th time, along with two deputies from BJP
content: Things were not going well... no question of going back now: Nitish Kumar

headlines: Behind BJP’s Deputy CM picks: OBC-upper caste faces, rewarding aggression, keeping Nitish Kumar in check
content: Apparently dissatisfied by its previous OBC-EBC leadership experiment, BJP has now trusted Samrat Choudhary & Vijay Sinha, who had been at forefront of taking on Nitish as Oppn leaders

headlines: Tejashwi’s next move: Take credit for jobs, raise development pitch and wait for Nitish to falter on his own
content: Having pushed back against pressure from own ranks to try form a new govt, Tejashwi Yadav will be now be leading RJD’s campaign projecting him as the "new development man" of Bihar

headlines: Vijay Kumar Sinha – New Bihar deputy CM who cut his teeth as an aggressive Speaker, LoP
content: A three-time MLA, Sinha as Speaker had several clashes with CM Nitish on the floor of the House while the two parties were in alliance between 2020-2022. It was cited by the JD(U) as among the reasons for its exit from the NDA then

headlines: Samrat Choudhary: Nitish Kumar baiter who is now his deputy
content: While he started out with Samata Party, co-floated by Nitish, Choudhary has done his share of political wandering, but in recent years emerged as the JD(U) leader's foremost BJP critic, even when the two were in alliance.

headlines: Congress throws ‘Aya Ram, Gaya Ram’ jibe at Nitish, but fears its chances of bettering 2019 tally hit
content: Congress is also facing charges of having adopted a 'callous attitude' towards allies, with Mamata's angry decision to contest alone, Nitish's exit and Bhagwant Mann's no tie-up salvo

headlines: Nitish Kumar: The perennial survivor, leader of all seasons
content: Nitish’s move to dump Mahagathbandhan to cross over to NDA to become CM for a record 9th term marks the fourth time in just over a decade that he has switched sides

headlines: Nitish Kumar resigns as Bihar CM, set to form govt with BJP
content: Nitish Kumar, whose JD(U) was in government with the RJD and the Congress, is expected to join hands with the BJP to form a new government in Bihar. Sources said the new government would be sworn in later on Sunday, at around 4 pm.

headlines: Nitish’s flip-flop, flip-flop: Numbers show it has always paid JD(U) to join hands with BJP in Lok SabhaSubscriber Only
content: In 2019 and 2009, when it contested as part of NDA, JD(U) had a good show in Lok Sabha polls, while 2014 solo act had left it flailing; in Assembly polls, it has had equal success with both NDA and Mahagathbandhan but 2020 was a jolt

headlines: Today in Politics: Bihar political configuration all set to change again, Bengal test for Rahul yatra
content: Plus, Bhupesh Baghel is in Patna as a section of Bihar Congress MLAs is said to be unreachable.

headlines: As Nitish Kumar continues to shake up Bihar politics, 4 reasons why he remains JD(U)’s Pied Piper
content: Despite the Bihar CM’s many flip-flops — he has changed sides four times in over a decade — his hold over his party has not loosened and he has prevented it from splitting.

headlines: Amid rumblings in INDIA bloc, Congress admits optics took a hit: ‘But alliance not imploding’
content: Party flies out Bhupesh Baghel to Patna amid reports that a section of the Congress MLAs in Bihar is unreachable

headlines: Shinde and BJP placate Marathas on quota issue but OBCs left unhappy, talk of protests
content: This will be politically significant for the ruling alliance of Shiv Sena led by Shinde, BJP, and the Ajit Pawar-led Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) ahead of the Lok Sabha elections and Assembly polls later this year as Marathas constitute 33% of the population.

headlines: All eyes on Patna today with Nitish Kumar set to break up, stake claim with BJP
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Prasad Yadav, who called a meeting of his MLAs Saturday, said they should "go to people with their achievements,” and delink the party from Nitish’s decision to break if and when it happens.

headlines: The legend of Jayalalithaa’s jewels: 27 years hence, some stories remain golden
content: The seizures made back in 1997 had the state marvelling at her saris, slippers, wine glasses, gold, diamonds, even a luxury bus. Will they finally make it back to TN? Maybe, not so soon

headlines: Ajit Pawar’s son with a penchant for controversies: Who is Parth Pawar, whose meeting with a ‘gangster’ has kicked up a row?
content: The 34-year-old who was trounced in the Lok Sabha elections five years ago wants to contest this time again and met Gajanan Marne who has a strong base in Pune’s Kothrud area and a strong following among the youth.

headlines: INDIA disquiet on UP front: Akhilesh springs a surprise, 11 seats for Cong which wanted more
content: The Congress, sources said, was hoping to get 15-16 seats in UP and Yadav’s announcement is seen as a bid to force the Congress’s hand and make it give one seat to the SP in Madhya Pradesh.

headlines: Jammu and Kashmir panchayat terms over, no polls in sight, local development work in limbo
content: Sarpanches say the panchayats should have been allowed to continue, flag concerns about ability of newly appointed block officers to address concerns of villagers

headlines: Decode Politics: Why the case of life convict Davinderpal Singh Bhullar continues to be a hot button issue in Punjab
content: As his premature release plea is rejected for the seventh time, Akalis point fingers at AAP govt in Delhi; latter blames BJP members on Tihar Jail board

headlines: Newsmaker | Meet Leishemba Sanajaoba, Rajya Sabha MP and Manipur’s titular king, with links to Arambai Tenggol
content: His sharing of stage with BJP in 2017 and later acceptance of RS ticket was first such political association by a Manipur royal; Kukis have demanded that his role in the ongoing conflict be scrutinised

headlines: Ahead of Budget Session, Gujarat Opposition space further shrinks
content: Already at a historic low, the Opposition numbers have been further depleted with three resignations, besides that of an Independent who had already pledged support to BJP

headlines: Today in Politics: Clarity likely in Bihar situation as Nitish Kumar plans his next move
content: Plus, a five-judge Supreme Court Bench will hold a special sitting after a Calcutta High Court judge accused a fellow judge of acting at a political party’s behest.

headlines: To placate, keep dissent in check, Congress govt in Karnataka appoints board, corporation chiefs
content: With Lok Sabha polls around the corner, party attempts to smooth things over with MLAs who did not get ministerial berths last year

headlines: Split fear and more, why Nitish Kumar dumped BJP in 2022 and why he is looking to return to NDA nowSubscriber Only
content: In 2022, Bihar CM felt sidelined by BJP, looked at Sena fate as a warning; now, his eyes on INDIA uncertainty and BJP surefootedness

headlines: Congress to raise with Centre ‘assault’ on its Manipur chief at meeting called by Meitei outfit
content: MLA says 3 legislators were assaulted, including 2 of BJP, at the meeting called by Arambai Tenggol, held under state and Central security

headlines: Akhilesh on the state of INDIA alliance: ‘Congress’s responsibility to bring together smaller parties’
content: “Ask yourself honestly what are you doing?” SP national secretary Rajeev Rai asks Congress as unease grows over reports of Nitish jumping ship, Mamata contesting on her own

headlines: Gyanvapi row: Parties silent, RSS, BJP likely to leave matter to courts
content: While Union minister Giriraj Singh urges Muslims to hand over mosque, across RSS, BJP, VHP, the thinking is there is no need for Sangh to get in, “when society is itself active on these issues”

headlines: After Jagannath shrine, Naveen Patnaik ready with another, Rs 200 crore temple showcase
content: Saturday's event, with fanfare including closure of educational institutions, is BJD's outreach towards western Odisha, which has tended to vote for the Opposition, as well as a counter to BJP’s Hindutva push

headlines: Nitish Kumar as CM and two Deputy CMs from BJP: JD(U)-BJP govt starts taking shape
content: EBC leader Renu Devi may return as Deputy CM; BJP leaders say survey giving the party 32 seats at best, against 39 for NDA last time, cleared the ground

headlines: Uttarakhand Assembly will hold special session on Feb 5 to pass Uniform Civil Code
content: BJP-ruled Gujarat, Assam plan similar Bill; three states may have UCC in place before Lok Sabha polls are held

headlines: How PM Modi’s Muslim world outreach blunts discordant notes at home
content: Just ahead of LS polls, PM Modi is going to visit UAE to inaugurate BAPS Hindu Mandir and address 'Ahlan Modi (Hello Modi)' event in Abu Dhabi

headlines: Decode Politics: Who are Arambai Tenggol, the group at whose beckoning Manipur Meitei MLAs came rushing
content: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh claims legislators were attacked at Wednesday's meeting "under full security protection of state and central forces"

headlines: Amid ally trouble, one party keeps Congress, others hanging: Prakash Ambedkar’s VBA
content: Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi leader, who has considerable Dalit, OBC support base, snubs an invite for seat-sharing talks by MVA leaders as he plays for more, seeks to cash in on the Maratha quota tension.

headlines: Today in Politics: Will Opposition respond to ASI report on Gyanvapi, what stand will RSS take?
content: Plus, Maratha quota protesters led by Manoj Jarange-Patil at Mumbai's doorstep but no permission given for hunger strike.

headlines: Post-Temple, BJP sets election ball rolling in Jammu and Kashmir, has eye on at least Anantnag apart from Jammu and Udhampur
content: As the party holds poll meetings, launches village campaign, its investment in tribal Gujjar-Bakerwal, Pahari populations and weakened opposition parties are expected to help BJP

headlines: Decode Politics: As Jarange-Patil brings Maratha quota battle to Mumbai, why Shinde govt has hopes riding on SC
content: The government says it is waiting for the Supreme Court verdict on its curative plea as it will give it a “clear idea on how to proceed with reservation” and come up with a solution that will be long-lasting and withstand legal and constitutional tests.

headlines: In Kerala, a book creates a ripple: Why it has put Congress in a spot
content: Late K M Mani's autobiography on the bar bribery scandal of 2014 was released by CM Pinarayi Vijayan in Thiruvananthapuram on Thursday.

headlines: As Nitish blows cold, Congress hopes to thaw Mamata to secure INDIA alliance
content: With a possible Nitish exit set to deal a fatal blow to the coalition, from Hindi heartland to caste census demand, Congress leaves no stone unturned to woo back the TMC chief.

headlines: All’s not well between Nitish, rest of the Opposition: 5 signs of friction in Bihar and INDIA alliancesSubscriber Only
content: From differences over simultaneous polls to fight over credit for health and job initiatives, the JD(U) and RJD have not seen eye to eye in recent weeks. Nitish was also said to be unhappy over the lack of consensus on his role in the INDIA alliance

headlines: Decode Politics: Lok Sabha polls to INDIA, why for BJP, getting Nitish a win-winSubscriber Only
content: Despite some reservations, state BJP leaders admit the JD(U) supremo and his party's 15% vote share a valuable plus

headlines: With Nitish poised to jump ship again, a saga  of his flip-flops on alliances with BJP, RJD
content: Nitish's switch would deal a severe blow to the ruling Mahagathbandhan in Bihar as well as the Opposition INDIA bloc at the national level

headlines: Nitish Kumar at U-turn again, BJP holds talks, allies hold breath
content: While refusing to confirm speculation, JD(U) leader K C Tyagi says INDIA bloc in trouble.

headlines: BJP beats Modi trumpet, campaign song focuses on PM, schemes
content: The refrain of the song is “He weaves weave reality, not dreams, that's why everyone chooses Modi"

headlines: Bhupinder Hooda now shuts door on AAP in Haryana after INDIA trouble in Bengal, Punjab
content: Former CM says a party can demand seats only where it has a base, claims Cong self-sufficient to win in the state; AAP is hoping for 5 seats, on borders with Punjab and Delhi

headlines: INDIA alliance in Bengal hangs on Congress demand for more than 2 seats, but why numbers an eyeopener
content: The Congress hasn’t been a major player in the state, in either Lok Sabha or Assembly polls, since the early 1970s. In more recent elections, it has fallen to some of its lowest vote shares and seat tallies

headlines: Five takeaways from Modi’s address to first-time voters
content: PM exhorts first-time voters to file suggestions for BJP manifesto on Namo app; talks about generation 'inspired by Ramayana, Gita, powered by AI'; tells youth to decide India's future by voting for stable, majority govts and against 'family-run parties'; lists achievements since 2014

headlines: Decode Politics: Why a radical Meitei outfit chose Imphal’s Kangla Fort to ‘summon’ legislators
content: As the seat of Manipur Meitei kings, the fort holds a deep cultural and historic symbolism for the community; its control by the Centre for long was also a cause of Manipuri 'alienation'

headlines: BSY hand in Jagadish Shettar’s full U-turn, returns to BJP ‘thanking it’
content: Congress hopes of wooing Lingayats likely to take a beating; Deputy CM Shivakumar says Shettar broke party’s trust, CM Siddaramaiah says Congress never insulted him

headlines: 1.8 minutes: Governor Arif Mohd Khan ‘budgets’ his Kerala House speech, skips all but first, last paras
content: One of the shortest policy addresses by a Kerala governor, skipped portions which included the state's criticism of Centre's fiscal policies. In earlier years, Khan has read similar passages

headlines: As ex-foreign secy Shringla steps up Darjeeling outreach, hills abuzz over his plunge into LS fray
content: Shringla has been projecting his ‘Bhumiputra’ credentials while connecting with people across Darjeeling seat, even as BJP has come under pressure to field a local face in the polls

headlines: On road to Ayodhya and to LS polls, Ram Temple is a factor, just strong enough to cut across other concerns
content: The grand celebration and ‘politicisation’ of the Mandir inauguration might divide people along party affiliations, but almost everyone is for the Temple. As BJP supporters cite law and order and infrastructure ‘improvement’, even those asking job, price rise questions say, "Where is the alternative"

headlines: Behind Mamata, Adhir face-off, a history of bad  blood, from Bengal Cong days through TMC rise
content: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury reason for INDIA alliance not working out between Congress and TMC in Bengal, alleges Derek O'Brien

headlines: In Karnataka, BJP sure of its Hindutva strongholds, not so much its sitting MPs
content: Uttara Kannada, Dakshina Kannada, Udupi Chikamagalur voted in BJP with highest victory margins in the state in 2019, but it was seen as more of a win for Modi, with leaders' popularity waning

headlines: Today in Politics: PM Modi set to kick off LS poll campaign, from addressing first-time voters to holding Bulandshahr rally
content: President Murmu will address the nation on eve of Republic Day; PM Modi will hold talks with French President Emmanuel Macron — the chief guest for Republic Day celebrations — in Jaipur

headlines: From new voters to scheme beneficiaries, BJP steps up outreachSubscriber Only
content: BJP leaders also said although big ticket announcements are not expected, the interim budget is also expected to “create a positive atmosphere and optimism” as “India’s glory as Vishwaguru would be one of the key themes in the BJP campaign” for the Lok Sabha elections.

headlines: Union minister, Rajya Sabha MP, MLAs across party lines in attendance after radical Meitei group ‘summons’ them
content: The Indian Express reached out to several MLAs who were at the meeting, but they either did not respond to calls or declined to elaborate on what had transpired.

headlines: Decode Politics: Why Mamata Banerjee has served Congress an ultimatum
content: The TMC chief can't afford to cede her dominance in a state where BJP challenge is mounting, fears giving more to Congress will only work to BJP's advantage

headlines: Mumbai suburb clashes, bulldozer action hit a colony that emerged out of an act of communal harmony
content: In 1979, Sena chief Bal Thackeray, IUML leader G M Banatwala together laid the foundation of Naya Nagar, conceived as a residential zone for Muslims, which had since kept its peace

headlines: In balancing act, Nitish takes jibe at PM Modi over Karpoori Bharat Ratna, slams dynasty politics
content: Bihar CM demands separate quotas for EBCs and OBCs at national level on the basis of Karpoori model; state BJP rules out his return to NDA

headlines: After Mamata Banerjee, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann says no alliance with Congress in Punjab
content: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann also said the AAP candidates will be chosen on winnability.

headlines: Congress hopes to placate Mamata, resolution in Punjab difficult
content: “We cannot imagine the INDIA bloc without Mamataji… We are hopeful that the talks are on,” says Jairam Ramesh

headlines: INDIA hits Bengal wall: Mamata says no talks, will fight Lok Sabha polls alone
content: In her statement, TMC supremo and West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said no talks were on with the Congress, her party would contest the coming Lok Sabha polls alone, and that the issue of a national alliance would be decided only after the elections.

headlines: Today in Politics: Maratha quota plea in SC, Nitish Kumar to address Karpoori Thakur birth centenary event
content: Plus, Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to virtually address first-time voters at a BJP Yuva Morcha conference.

headlines: In ‘Bharat Ratna’ Karpoori Thakur, Modi govt may have another winner
content: Its previous 5 Bharat Ratnas, in nearly 10 yrs in power, have included Madan Mohan Malviya, Vajpayee, Pranab Mukherjee, Bhupen Hazarika, Nanaji Deshmukh; UPA 10 years saw 3 awardees

headlines: Bharat Ratna for ‘Jan Nayak’ Karpoori Thakur: BJP bid to blunt JD(U)-RJD social justice pitch
